commit_message:
Update ceilosca.sh to Newton vintage

Update the included local.conf settings which ceilosca.sh uses
to configure services.
Update the README.md to reflect ceilosca.sh update
Add a workaround to plugin.sh to avoid an issue with auth_url
and the ceilometer client.
Change to bento/ubuntu-16.04 Vagrant box.

Change-Id: Ibc9e1baf64658a670bc697d586b3ca34af33fe18

commit_message:
Use Ansible 2.4

This bumps the ansible version to 2.4, and ensures the user can
still override its group/host vars.

This also moves the group/host vars directly in the inventory
tree, to be closer to what the standard expectations of ansible
are.

Change-Id: Ic7d2fb7a777e74637699874ca8b15ecd18c3ea43

[{'created': '2017-12-11 18:33:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update HAProxy default timeout values

The default HAProxy values are set in the layer-openstack template for
haproxy. Bring the layer-openstack-api default configuration in line
with the classic charms which do not set values in the config.yaml but
rely on the template. If any future changes are required, a change in
one place (layer-openstack) will affect all charms.

Change-Id: I045d66bf606ef57b066b4d6af1d4829eeed3bc93

Change-Id: I045d66bf606ef57b066b4d6af1d4829eeed3bc93

commit_message:
Update HAProxy default timeout values

The default HAProxy values are set in the layer-openstack template for
haproxy. Bring the layer-openstack-api default configuration in line
with the classic charms which do not set values in the config.yaml but
rely on the template. If any future changes are required, a change in
one place (layer-openstack) will affect all charms.

Change-Id: I045d66bf606ef57b066b4d6af1d4829eeed3bc93

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 19:37:31.000000000', 'message': 'Generate MysqlRootPassword and RabbitCookie

These were being generated inside the tripleo heat templates before.
This was causing idempotency issues in the undercloud since the heat
stack is ephemeral.  Having them be generated here allows us to save
them to a state file for reuse.

Change-Id: I120699d51f7ef3e89b134d5442803ac5d0c682a2
'}]
commit_message:
Generate MysqlRootPassword and RabbitCookie

These were being generated inside the tripleo heat templates before.
This was causing idempotency issues in the undercloud since the heat
stack is ephemeral.  Having them be generated here allows us to save
them to a state file for reuse.

Change-Id: I120699d51f7ef3e89b134d5442803ac5d0c682a2

commit_message:
Create tripleo-upgrade gerrit group

tripleo-upgrade gerrit group will include tripleo-core, but include
specific core reviewers focused on upgrades work.

Change-Id: I94183a5051e4769ba404bedf6d1cc93daf927cac

messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2017-12-11 18:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-12-11 18:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 18:29:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update HAProxy default timeout values

The default HAProxy timeout values are fairly strict. On a busy cloud
it is common to exceed one or more of these timeouts. The only
indication that HAProxy has exceeded a timeout and dropped the
connection is errors such as "BadStatusLine" or "EOF." These can be
very difficult to diagnose when intermittent.

This change updates the default timeout values to more real world
settings. These values have been extensively tested in ServerStack.
Configured values will not be overridden.

Change-Id: I1f0167002fdc1e9e14eaa9ed9a6a365173a3406e
'}]
commit_message:
Update HAProxy default timeout values

The default HAProxy timeout values are fairly strict. On a busy cloud
it is common to exceed one or more of these timeouts. The only
indication that HAProxy has exceeded a timeout and dropped the
connection is errors such as "BadStatusLine" or "EOF." These can be
very difficult to diagnose when intermittent.

This change updates the default timeout values to more real world
settings. These values have been extensively tested in ServerStack.
Configured values will not be overridden.

Change-Id: I1f0167002fdc1e9e14eaa9ed9a6a365173a3406e

commit_message:
Update CI Jobs

- Added 'manager_model' flag for old style
  pool-manager + zone-manager

- Added grenade testing for verify_noapi which
  shows we can do an upgrade without impacting the
  data plane

- Removed old keystone v3 test (v2 no longer exists, so
  we are already testing it

- Make py35 job voting

- Stop dsvm jobs on docs / releasenotes / api-ref changes

Change-Id: I0de8d8c3366bb0325a73dd19ce0e1f9a57553d0b

commit_message:
Update k8s utils and prometheus plugin

For k8s we are updating the pod owner
functionaility

Kubernetes 1.6 and newer supports having owner
reference instead if parsing name. This patch
takes advantage of that.

For prometheus we are adding the ability to look
up pod owner based on a pod dimension. This is
key when using kube-state-metrics so we dont
have dead alarms

Also includes a minor fix in k8s plugin for memory

Patch also includes changes to our agent tests as
we now allow () in our new dimensions keys and values
and our tests were not updated for this change yet

Change-Id: I17ea7f42d4b23534221675309c31feeafa75d20c

messages:
[{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-11-20 22:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-06 17:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, let's revisit admins list, I'm fine with removing new admins. But why to remove copying files??"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-06 19:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Because the copying files should have been separately from the addition of new admins. The point I think Ben is pointing out that this was multiple changes and each one should have been done separately. The course of action would be to revert this, and re-apply the various changes with the appropriate approvals for each of the keys as separate patches.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-09 00:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:01:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Because the copying files should have been separately from the
 > addition of new admins. The point I think Ben is pointing out that
 > this was multiple changes and each one should have been done
 > separately. The course of action would be to revert this, and
 > re-apply the various changes with the appropriate approvals for
 > each of the keys as separate patches.

Exactly.  I wouldn't ordinarily revert a patch that had already merged with multiple changes (although I would -1 if I caught it before it merged), but in this case it involved admin access to our cloud which I think is important enough to warrant it.

I'd have been okay with a partial revert too, but IMHO this is a little cleaner.  And it makes a bit stronger point about not doing this sort of thing."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 22:54:27.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Install ssh keys of tripleo ci admins on nodes"

It was highly inappropriate to add new ci admins in this change,
especially without mentioning it in the commit message.
Note that strictly speaking we require a quorum of the
existing admins to approve adding new ones, although with the
number of admins growing we may want to revisit that policy.
As of this time it is still in effect, however.[1]

And even if it weren't, it shouldn't have been
piggy-backed on this change.  Please resubmit as two separate
changes so the admin change can be properly reviewed.

1: Unfortunately we lost the documentation of this when the
admin list was moved from tripleo-incubator to tripleo-ci:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-incubator/blob/4de13b35d91150eb269bea22820d0e688cd6b643/tripleo-cloud/README.md
That should be fixed too.

This reverts commit a4d1f8c9605299053ec3e4b19f4b885ea2d0619f.

Change-Id: I6a5484dfb1c00431ae89ec20d9dd66b623b3e622
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Install ssh keys of tripleo ci admins on nodes"

It was highly inappropriate to add new ci admins in this change,
especially without mentioning it in the commit message.
Note that strictly speaking we require a quorum of the
existing admins to approve adding new ones, although with the
number of admins growing we may want to revisit that policy.
As of this time it is still in effect, however.[1]

And even if it weren't, it shouldn't have been
piggy-backed on this change.  Please resubmit as two separate
changes so the admin change can be properly reviewed.

1: Unfortunately we lost the documentation of this when the
admin list was moved from tripleo-incubator to tripleo-ci:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-incubator/blob/4de13b35d91150eb269bea22820d0e688cd6b643/tripleo-cloud/README.md
That should be fixed too.

This reverts commit a4d1f8c9605299053ec3e4b19f4b885ea2d0619f.

Change-Id: I6a5484dfb1c00431ae89ec20d9dd66b623b3e622

commit_message:
Fix dispatcher params

Currently we join the params and pass in a string to the dispatcher
settings. This wont work as ceilometer config expects separate
lines for each value.

(cherry picked from commit a791baa616668e8b7ce12e49d7f918a52293b74f)
(cherry picked from commit 22abe647e6c54c8877245912d35da44a694edf04)
Closes-bug: #1737418
Change-Id: I3813f0918c8394ef14959be7580bf026314ba82e

We record installed packages and enabled repositories for the host but
we also need to collect such information for the containers since this
is where the infrastructure and OpenStack services are running.

Change-Id: I009cbfbc87a0b8b6cf3013b3fae41343876810fd
'}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Collect package and repo information from containers

We record installed packages and enabled repositories for the host but
we also need to collect such information for the containers since this
is where the infrastructure and OpenStack services are running.

Change-Id: I009cbfbc87a0b8b6cf3013b3fae41343876810fd

commit_message:
Add option to set the check port

The option to set the checkport is needed when trying to balance traffic
to a service that uses a secondary port to verify service availability.
This is being implemented to support galera which should be using an
HTTP based check to verify sync status instead of a simple mysql login.
For reference this is what the folks at Percona are recommending [0].

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html
Closes-Bug: #1665667

Change-Id: I81c924464aa4b19c2a62f37b5bf26c3c0453786a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0eb657614ed82eda0c7e45773aa631c2d8073542)

commit_message:
Add option to set the check port

The option to set the checkport is needed when trying to balance traffic
to a service that uses a secondary port to verify service availability.
This is being implemented to support galera which should be using an
HTTP based check to verify sync status instead of a simple mysql login.
For reference this is what the folks at Percona are recommending [0].

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html
Closes-Bug: #1665667

Change-Id: I81c924464aa4b19c2a62f37b5bf26c3c0453786a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0eb657614ed82eda0c7e45773aa631c2d8073542)

commit_message:
nimble: handle unicode strings in volume create

currently nimble cinder driver doesn't handle unicode strings
for display_name and display_description

Change-Id: Idfa1ab179de1b7326dc84657e2d41688dba9fe57

(9 comments)

Merging this change along with monasca-notification will surely break devstack gate. Reasons are as follow:

- this change does not modify devstack/files/monasca-notification/notification.yaml to include newly added properties.
- only one topic out of 2 required (mentioned in monasca-notification change) by monasca-notification is being created here
- Py35 is Pike release goal that monasca-api will most likely fail to meet. Nevertheless introducing more incompatibility is not acceptable from my POV. There's already a lot of problems that me and Artur are trying to overcome in https://review.openstack.org/349195

Also I suggest having:

- Depends-On to include monasca-notification change
- the same topic for both changes as it is not clear that both must be tested all together"}, {'account_id': 14517, 'date': '2017-07-06 22:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: -Code-Review

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-19 20:44:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add API Resources for Alarm Group, Inhibition and Silence

    Alarm grouping is used to categorize alarms of similar nature into
    a single notification. This functionality is very usefully
    especially during large outages when many systems fail at once and
    thousands of alarms go off simultaneously.

    Inhibition allows user to mute a set of alarms (target alarms)
    given that another alarm (source alarm) is firing. For example,
    we can use this to mute any low level alarms if the same alarm is
    already critical.

    Silencing manager will mute alarms for a given time based on
    input parameters: start_time and end_time. A silence is configured
    based on matchers and if an incoming alarm is checked to match the
    matchers, no notifications will be sent out for that alarm.

    This review is to merge several reviews together so that testing will
    be easier:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/432499/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435632/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436698/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447060/

    Story: 2000935
    Task: 4068
    Tast: 4067
    Task: 4059

Change-Id: I3509be99311e98031ffb985b8cd6f1c1562ecbd5
Co-Authored-By: Andrea Adams <aadams@hpe.com>

    given that another alarm (source alarm) is firing. For example,
    we can use this to mute any low level alarms if the same alarm is
    already critical.

    Silencing manager will mute alarms for a given time based on
    input parameters: start_time and end_time. A silence is configured
    based on matchers and if an incoming alarm is checked to match the
    matchers, no notifications will be sent out for that alarm.

    This review is to merge several reviews together so that testing will
    be easier:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/432499/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435632/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436698/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447060/

    Silence rule will mute alarms for a given time based on
    input parameters: start_time and end_time. A silence is configured
    based on matchers and if an incoming alarm is checked to match the
    matchers, no notifications will be sent out for that alarm.

'}, {'created': '2017-06-22 22:48:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add API Resources for Group, Inhibit and Silence Rules

    Group rule is used to categorize alarms of similar nature into
    a single notification. This functionality is very usefully
    especially during large outages when many systems fail at once and
    thousands of alarms go off simultaneously.

    Inhibit rule allows user to mute a set of alarms (target alarms)
    given that another alarm (source alarm) is firing. For example,
    we can use this to mute any low level alarms if the same alarm is
    already critical.

    Silence rule will mute alarms for a given time based on
    input parameters: start_time and end_time. A silence is configured
    based on matchers and if an incoming alarm is checked to match the
    matchers, no notifications will be sent out for that alarm.

commit_message:
Add API Resources for Group, Inhibit and Silence Rules

    Group rule is used to categorize alarms of similar nature into
    a single notification. This functionality is very usefully
    especially during large outages when many systems fail at once and
    thousands of alarms go off simultaneously.

    Inhibit rule allows user to mute a set of alarms (target alarms)
    given that another alarm (source alarm) is firing. For example,
    we can use this to mute any low level alarms if the same alarm is
    already critical.

    Silence rule will mute alarms for a given time based on
    input parameters: start_time and end_time. A silence is configured
    based on matchers and if an incoming alarm is checked to match the
    matchers, no notifications will be sent out for that alarm.

    This review is to merge several reviews together so that testing will
    be easier:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/432499/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435632/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436698/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447060/

    Story: 2000935
    Task: 4068
    Tast: 4067
    Task: 4059

Depends-On: I3c12c3737ddac064ee2665b6e79369c7613cbea9
Depends-On: I85b8bfc9338ee17709ec30aeb4b807b3bc12404e

Change-Id: I3509be99311e98031ffb985b8cd6f1c1562ecbd5
Co-Authored-By: Andrea Adams <aadams@hpe.com>

legacy-glanceclient-* are failing because although those jobs are deleted on this patch, they haven't yet been removed from project-config (the patch to remove them is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525044/ ); since this patch removes the post_test_hook.sh, when those tests try to access the post_test_hook.sh, it's not found and the jobs fail."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-08 17:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The new jobs are failing during devstack setup in lib/databases/mysql:configure_database_mysql

From the logs it looks like the user/password are being injected into the mysql package using debconf-set-selections,  but this happens later in the run:

mysqladmin: connect to server at '127.0.0.1' failed
error: 'Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost''
sudo mysql -uroot -psecretdatabase -h127.0.0.1 -e 'GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ...
ERROR 1698 (28000): Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost'"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-11 17:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Was squashed into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525045/'}]

subject: Add libssl and openssl to fix pep8
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-07 20:02:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add libssl and openssl to fix pep8

pep8 failed with "fatal error: openssl/openssl.h: No such file or
directory". To fix this, we need to add libssl development headers
to bindel.txt.

Please see the link below for more info:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-June/117951.html

Change-Id: I6f9130c41ca96f21cd0f4521d8b6d0da99c75dda
'}]
commit_message:
Add libssl and openssl to fix pep8

pep8 failed with "fatal error: openssl/openssl.h: No such file or
directory". To fix this, we need to add libssl development headers
to bindel.txt.

Please see the link below for more info:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-June/117951.html

Change-Id: I6f9130c41ca96f21cd0f4521d8b6d0da99c75dda

commit_message:
placement: avoid returning duplicated alloc_reqs when no sharing rp

This patch returns from the loop early where there are no sharing
rps, avoiding generating duplicated requests.

Change-Id: I7c73b720f09bb2371770b1c6de537bb5527785a9
Closes-Bug: #1709788
(cherry picked from commit 2e5f293f13e8f38e8cb6b4b58bd69d04eb808b9e)

commit_message:
Refactor volume groups and group snapshots tests

According to api microversion history of Cinder[1], min microversion for
volume groups (create/delete/update/list/show) is 3.13, min microversion
for group snapshots(create/delete/list/show) and create group from group
or group snapshot is 3.14.

While in GroupsTest in Tempest, the min microversion for volume groups is
set to 3.14. This patch aims to refactor the original GroupsTest to correct
the min microversion for volume groups, and also spilt it into two parts,
one for groups tests and the other for group snapshot tests, which will make
the code more clear and readable.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html

Change-Id: Ic98e8892c4a44850d7a7afac9be1aa59ab38bb8c

commit_message:
Stop using resource_cleanup in identity_v3 tests

Replace resource_cleanup with addClassResourceCleanup in identity
v3 tests.

Besides, in test_update_endpoint, service2 should be created before
endpoint_for_update is created, because Service2 must be deleted after
endpoint_for_update is deleted, otherwise we will get a 404 error
when deleting endpoint_for_update if endpoint's service is deleted.

And in test_domain_configuration, group created in resource_setup
is not used anywhere, so to remove it.

Change-Id: I00f5308f953bac191697fb7312b5f56093e80039

subject: Replace DbMigrationError with DBMigrationError

The old exception is still in use:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db/tree/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/migration.py#n81

I see you have a patch up to change the above, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500472/.  I think we need to mark this patch right here as Depends-on: Icb2c88dc18843cbf2f5be08d635d5ba10f36f360 so that it won't merge until oslo.db no longer throws the deprecated exception."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-09-07 15:51:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Isn't the dependency the other way? Consumers of the library need to stop using the old exception before it can be removed from the library.

I suppose we could wait until it's actually gone, but then that has the risk of turning into a fire drill, right?"}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2017-09-07 15:58:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with Sean McGinnis. I think it's better for consumers to use the new class first, and then oslo can remove the deprecated one safely."}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2017-09-07 15:59:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with Sean McGinnis. I think it's better for consumers to use the new class first, and then oslo can remove the deprecated one safely."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-09-07 15:59:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Maybe the dependency is on a requirements change? I don't want to change Glance  until we know we won't see the deprecated dependency any more.  Either that, or the change to glance is to catch both versions for now."}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2017-09-07 16:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From the oslo PTL's point of view, he hopes consumers to stop using the deprecated exception so that the old exception can be removed safely, otherwise, consumer project will encounter a build error because of lacking the old exception. 

For now, it's safe to use new exception in glance.

see also:
1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500472/  (see the comment of ChangBo Guo(gcb))
2. http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db/tree/oslo_db/exception.py#n224"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-09-07 16:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Some discussion on this in IRC. Looks like there may be some issues with the way this is being handled.

DBMigration is being inherited from DbMigration. So if a consumer is catching the deprecated exception, it is handling both cases of exceptions. But there are still some places in the code raising the deprecated exception. If consuming code only catches the newer DBMigration, then if the old one is thrown it will not be caught.

That inheritance probably needs to be switched, or probably the better solution, all the instances in the code throwing the deprecated exception should be updated to the new exception. Then a release will need to be made (and minimum requirements raised) so consumers have assurance that it is safe to move to catching the new exception,,'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-09-07 19:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

After reviewing what Sean said I would agree with going back and altering the existing exceptions to be updated to throw the newer ones.'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2017-09-08 03:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/501941'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2017-09-08 08:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Maybe it'ok for now."}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2017-09-08 08:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Replace DbMigrationError with DBMigrationError

DbMigrationError is deprecated and will NOT be thrown in oslo.db
since oslo.db >=4.27.0, DBMigrationError will be thrown instead.
Consumers should catch DBMigrationError instead of DbMigrationError

Depends-On: Iab0566cf9f4552e91fa417e64472fa106e8bc86d
Depends-On: I0ebd69c3d778acb5bec9e136627e345e7fcf2bd3

Change-Id: Ic2fe5bd6be16d61df3257560c2072b075603672f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 12:05:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tempest plugins installation

The conditional was wrong, and therefore always skipped.
When you have registered the output of with items, you get the
whole list in _registered_var.results.

Each item is the result itself, and for convenience, ansible
throws in the original item under the dict "item".

So here original item's repo in the results should be in
_registered_var.results[0].item.repo while the stat of the folder
should be in _registered_var.results[0].stat.<whatever>.

Replace _registered_var.results[::] with item and you get your
conditional. Magic!

Change-Id: I44acb420155d3bc09b271a4b2fa92b488aae4c89
(cherry picked from commit 9de4f4a9ba541fbe788cc00b315d44803231a626)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest plugins installation

The conditional was wrong, and therefore always skipped.
When you have registered the output of with items, you get the
whole list in _registered_var.results.

Each item is the result itself, and for convenience, ansible
throws in the original item under the dict "item".

So here original item's repo in the results should be in
_registered_var.results[0].item.repo while the stat of the folder
should be in _registered_var.results[0].stat.<whatever>.

Replace _registered_var.results[::] with item and you get your
conditional. Magic!

Change-Id: I44acb420155d3bc09b271a4b2fa92b488aae4c89
(cherry picked from commit 9de4f4a9ba541fbe788cc00b315d44803231a626)

commit_message:
Resolve python lint failures

https://review.openstack.org/513626 did not include the
docs config changes to resolve the python lint tests
like https://review.openstack.org/512973 did, so this
patch resolves the errors now happening in lint tests.

Change-Id: I30dd9ade1eba507e646777bada8b56f30e46de8a

commit_message:
Add option to set the check port

The option to set the checkport is needed when trying to balance traffic
to a service that uses a secondary port to verify service availability.
This is being implemented to support galera which should be using an
HTTP based check to verify sync status instead of a simple mysql login.
For reference this is what the folks at Percona are recommending [0].

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html
Closes-Bug: #1665667

Change-Id: I81c924464aa4b19c2a62f37b5bf26c3c0453786a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0eb657614ed82eda0c7e45773aa631c2d8073542)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 14:38:25.000000000', 'message': 'Liveness script
An alternative to talking to the monitors: consult the unix-domain sockets instead of the monitors.

Exits 0 iff there is one or more active admin sockets and all daemons
claim to be active per "ceph status".  Exits 1 otherwise.  Note that
this isn't perfect: we don't know how many daemons SHOULD be active,
so if only a subset is live and the others have no sockets (yet?),
we'll still claim the pod is ready.

Change-Id: I5d370b4bc4025fece2e640355c3a29167afca871

'}, {'created': '2017-08-29 12:33:22.000000000', 'message': 'Liveness script

The current TCP socket-based liveness/readiness check for OSDs
doesn't accurately reflect when OSDs are live, doesn't handle
multiple OSDs on a host, and doesn't work when hostNetworking is
in use and the Ceph network is different from the one associated
with the hostname.  This change adds a new script for checking ceph
liveness/readiness that queries the OSD Unix domain sockets to
get daemon status and exits 0 iff all sockets report that their
daemons are in an "active" state.

This isn't perfect: we don't know how many daemons SHOULD be active,
so if only a subset is live and the others have no sockets (yet?),
we'll still claim the pod is ready.  The script also doesn't
distinguish between liveness and readiness.

Change-Id: I5d370b4bc4025fece2e640355c3a29167afca871

commit_message:
Ceph liveness scripts

Replace socket-based liveness checks with scripts

The current TCP socket-based liveness/readiness check for Ceph
doesn't accurately reflect when daemons are live, doesn't handle
multiple OSDs on a host, and doesn't work when hostNetworking is
in use and the Ceph network is different from the one associated
with the hostname.  This change adds new scripts for checking
Ceph monitor and OSD liveness/readiness that query the Ceph Unix
domain sockets to get daemon status and exits 0 iff all sockets
report that their daemons are in an "active" state.

This isn't perfect: we don't know how many daemons SHOULD be
active, so if only a subset is live and the others have no
sockets (yet?), we'll still claim the pod is ready.  The scripts
also don't distinguish between liveness and readiness for OSDs.

Change-Id: I5d370b4bc4025fece2e640355c3a29167afca871

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-11 13:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-11 13:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-11 16:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-12-11 16:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 13:43:01.000000000', 'message': "Implement a proper WSREP check for galera

The galera cluster rely on WSREP for cluster consistency. While the
default MySQL monitor will allow us to know when the database node is
minimally functional it does not provide the ability to query the node
state allowing loadbalancers, operators, and deployers to know a node
is healthy prior to being allowed to accept connections. This change
implements the checkcluster script as provided by the fine folks at
Percona. The implementation of this check follows the guild-lines noted
here [0]. With this in-place, we'll be able to convert our haproxy check
for the galera cluster nodes to use an HTTP check on port 9200 instead
of the default MySQL login which will provide for a more robust and
fault tolerant cluster.

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/520665
- https://review.openstack.org/523850

Closes-Bug: #1665667
Change-Id: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-12-11 13:46:43.000000000', 'message': "Implement a proper WSREP check for galera

here [0]. With this in-place, we'll be able to convert our haproxy check
for the galera cluster nodes to use an HTTP check on port 9200 instead
of the default MySQL login which will provide for a more robust and
fault tolerant cluster.

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/520665
- https://review.openstack.org/523850

Closes-Bug: #1665667
Change-Id: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96

"}]
commit_message:
Implement a proper WSREP check for galera

The galera cluster rely on WSREP for cluster consistency. While the
default MySQL monitor will allow us to know when the database node is
minimally functional it does not provide the ability to query the node
state allowing loadbalancers, operators, and deployers to know a node
is healthy prior to being allowed to accept connections. This change
implements the checkcluster script as provided by the fine folks at
Percona. The implementation of this check follows the guild-lines noted
here [0]. With this in-place, we'll be able to convert our haproxy check
for the galera cluster nodes to use an HTTP check on port 9200 instead
of the default MySQL login which will provide for a more robust and
fault tolerant cluster.

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/520665
- https://review.openstack.org/523850

Closes-Bug: #1665667
Change-Id: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 16:09:28.000000000', 'message': "Avoid using 'roles' reserved variable

This patch clears up an Ansible warning that is thrown each time the
`get-ansible-role-requirements.yml` playbook runs. The playbook has
a variable called `roles`, but that's a reserved variable name.

The patch changes the variable name to `required_roles` to avoid the
warning.

Closes-Bug: 1735781
Change-Id: I91e5505408e53271155ac80e2997595ddf3b8781

commit_message:
Avoid using 'roles' reserved variable

This patch clears up an Ansible warning that is thrown each time the
`get-ansible-role-requirements.yml` playbook runs. The playbook has
a variable called `roles`, but that's a reserved variable name.

The patch changes the variable name to `required_roles` to avoid the
warning.

Closes-Bug: 1735781
Change-Id: I91e5505408e53271155ac80e2997595ddf3b8781

Unskip volume show host test

This PS unskips volume show how test because the related bug
was fixed [0] and now the endpoint appears in the policy in code
documentation for "volume_extension:hosts" [1].

I think putting something in a "Limitations" document would better serve this than release notes, probably somewhere in the Placement docs:

As for the FPGA example, that's true, but it's an example in the spec, it doesn't mean we declare support for FPGAs. The original resource providers spec from Mitaka talked about shared storage pools and IP allocation pools, but we don't support those yet. Those are long-term vision type examples. commit_message:
doc: note that custom resources are not fully supported

During fixing placement related bugs it turned out that supporting
the generic usage of custom resource classes needs the shared storage
providers feature.

The FPGA use case described in the custom-resource-classes
specification depends on the shared resource provider feature.
The custom FPGA resource needs to be provided by an independent
resource provider per compute host. That FPGA resource provider
needs to share the FPGA resource with the compute resource provider
associated to the same compute host. This makes the FPGA resource
provider a shared resource provider which is not supported in Pike.

Change-Id: I04a0447d76b825908eca0d8817d50495f31d51b5

commit_message:
doc: note that custom resources are not fully supported

During fixing placement related bugs it turned out that supporting
the generic usage of custom resource classes needs the shared storage
providers feature.

The FPGA use case described in the custom-resource-classes
specification depends on the shared resource provider feature.
The custom FPGA resource needs to be provided by an independent
resource provider per compute host. That FPGA resource provider
needs to share the FPGA resource with the compute resource provider
associated to the same compute host. This makes the FPGA resource
provider a shared resource provider which is not supported in Pike.

Change-Id: I04a0447d76b825908eca0d8817d50495f31d51b5

commit_message:
Add shared backing storage

If user has already defined volume in pool it can be used as
    backing storage for node disk.

        - name: system
          capacity: !os_env NODE_VOLUME_SIZE, 150
          shared_backing_store_name: !os_env IMAGE_NAME
          format: qcow2

Change-Id: Ib1ec1daf74d9bd2c78288cc507e4b32c7233ef3d

commit_message:
Added gitreview and dot files

* In order to interact with openstack gerrit, we need to gitreview
  as well as .gitignore for ignoring unnecessary files.

Change-Id: I58f92c6d99078dfc2c1820a7fa4788989a0c66a5

commit_message:
Re-work the direct action call tempest test

The current version calls the Mistral API, this seems to be unstable.
Using another std action is enough to validate that this works
correctly.

Related-Bug: #1736685

commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Collect all environment variables

We export many variables throughout the CI jobs so it's helpful to
collect them all as part of the job results.

Change-Id: Ic12bb7efa6e841108d56a9368917157c4e104c77

commit_message:
Use volumev3 for internal endpoint in >= Pike

volumev2 api is deprecated for >= Pike so select
volumev3 for internal endpoint when using >= Pike.

Also moved cinder_catalog_info config to
[glance_store] section which should have been done
a long time ago.

Change-Id: Ia9c002199d939ba20c029b70d2eb3c6b6cdc51a6
Partial-Bug: #1733566

commit_message:
Remove usage of deprecated config 'resources_prefix'

Config option 'resources_prefix' was deprecated and marked
for removal.
- https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/6dd6fc66d8a04bdba8063f34244e7db2f70a7251/tempest/config.py#L1081

Tempest is going to remove this config options soon.

This commit removes its usage and hardcode the resource
prefix to 'tempest'

Change-Id: I9c140b3a9efabeced7fc26cb1f169ebe6789d88b

nits'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-23 10:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I cannot understand what this patch tries to achieve.
Looking at the code, it just allows admin to attach a volume to instances from the current project. This is what the project dashboard provides.
In case of instances from other projects, a volume list will be empty and as a result no volume can be attached.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 10:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > I cannot understand what this patch tries to achieve.
 > Looking at the code, it just allows admin to attach a volume to
 > instances from the current project. This is what the project
 > dashboard provides.
 > In case of instances from other projects, a volume list will be
 > empty and as a result no volume can be attached.

This patch tries to add option "Attach Volume" to the admin panel. The  admin panel should have actions as or more than project panel.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 10:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-23 11:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26766, 'date': '2017-11-23 12:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 12:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:02:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-11-23 14:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-23 20:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26766, 'date': '2017-12-03 14:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-03 14:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Published edit on patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-03 14:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Published edit on patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 26766, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Published edit on patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:18:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2017-12-05 10:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-2

This change is dangerous. It implicitly involves ownership change of a volume . The ownership change is considered as a dangerous operation and at least some confirmation must be involved.

I would suggest you to propose a change to the openstack operator list which many OpenStack operators read and get positive feedbacks (and no strong negative responses) before moving this forward.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Note that the horizon team cannot decide this is the right way without feedbacks from operators. Most operators cannot image an ownership change from "Attach Volume". It proposes a really surprising behavior, so we need positive feedbacks from existing OpenStack operators.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2017-12-10 05:15:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

I agree that it's unexpected that the attach volume action will change the ownership of the volume, so we shouldn't do that. We should show only the volumes which have the same owner as the instance for this action."}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-10 12:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

I did this in previous commits but it was refused.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-11 06:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

The reason I opposed in the past patch sets is because it handed the current project specially and did nothing for other projects without any messages.

If you would like to add Attach Volume button in the admin instance table, I think you first need to check whether a user of project-A can attach a volume from project-B to an instance from project-B. If it can, it is worth having the Attach Volume button. Otherwise, it turns out the Attach Volume operation is only for the current project and "Attach Volume" action in the admin instance table would be meaningless.

Bug 1704833 just says "Some actions are missing on admin/instances panel". It does not discuss what actions are worth added and what actions are not. From the discussion so far, I think "Attach Volume" is not worth added in the admin instance panel from a reasonable reason.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Published edit on patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Patch Set 18 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 26766, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 27288, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add more actions to admin.

Admin can Rebulid and Shut off instance from instances in admin panel.

Closes-Bug: 1704833
Change-Id: I8d17b0f98919006f1b5705d2f1bf937dfb6317a7

commit_message:
zuul: add irrelevant-files section to job

This adds the 'irrelevant-files' section to the job
networking-generic-switch-tempest-dsvm-dlm. If all the
changes are in this list, the job is not run.

Change-Id: I89ae9892f66441be9889658ffaa7c44a88da75c7

It seems reasonable. I don't like that we still have an issue with dependent objects getting created on different servers (network created on one server, port on another w/ port code running before the network is fully created). But that can be solved at a different time. (Maybe we could expose the ovsdb "wait" operation to the idl and prepend a "wait until Logical_Switch with name = 'x'" op to the transaction where we do port creates, etc.)'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2017-08-14 18:56:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

I'm going to hold off on approving this for a little bit longer.  It doesn't need to block implementation, and I'd like to leave some more time for review and feedback."}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2017-08-14 21:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-08-15 08:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-08-15 15:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(4 comments)

Current Openstack practices for "distributed locking" is based around tooz, which is an abstraction layer on top of many different backends including MySQL, Redis, etcd3, zookeeper, etc.   Definitely should be considered here and discussed why/why not: https://docs.openstack.org/tooz/latest/user/drivers.html

Re: the "yet another layer of complexity" argument re: tooz, if a particular software layer is already prevalent throughout openstack components then it is not new complexity to simply subscribe onto that existing channel of functionality; inventing a new system that does the same thing totally differently would be the option that is more complex in this case.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-08-16 08:30:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-2

(5 comments)

Thanks Michael, Ollie and Han for the comments they are extremely useful. I'll extend the spec to incorporate the suggestions from your comments and also with the things I found when implementing a PoC."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-08-16 09:12:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Mike, just saw the comment about tooz now. Yeah, definitely something to look at. I've tried to use tooz long ago when I was working in Ironic and found some problems with it: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278001/

But, I will re-evaluate it, thanks for the pointers!"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-10-12 13:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-12 13:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified-1

commit_message:
Idea proposal: Neutron/OVN database consistency problem

This patch is proposing an alternative idea to fix the database
consistency problem between Neutron and OVN.

Change-Id: I2719faf41fd323536378e1c16b5f336ead5dcd68

subject: Remove redundant SetLSwitchPortCommand in trunk driver

commit_message:
Remove redundant SetLSwitchPortCommand in trunk driver

self.plugin_driver._plugin.update_port is invoked by the OVN trunk driver,
which actually is update_port in the ml2 plugin.
update_port invokes mechanismDriver callback and then OVN updates lsp.
Therefore, the separate set_lswitch_port in OVN trunk driver is redundant,
it should be deleted.
Because of this change, unit test cases need to be adapted.
And patch[1] is squashed into this patch to avoid conflict.
[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526407/

Change-Id: I202bc72e6978bc532a00a5a7c9161de3f85a9324

commit_message:
[WIP] split ovb playbook

Separate quickstart ovb playbook into smaller
playbooks that follow the same breakpoints as the libvirt playbook in
tripleo-quickstart-extras.

The tasks are taken from the baremetal-quickstart-extras.yml new ovb
one-for-all playbook.

This is part of the preparations to convert CI to follow the step by
step workflow the users will follow to reproduce CI

Change-Id: I8ddb2f782a4f6261ac0dedef4dfb1c14dfea32e6

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:50:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, Witek and me discussed this a bit and we both came to the conclusion that retrying this on a per-request basis is the best approach. I then gave an implementation some thought this morning:

1) Instead of defaulting to 0.11.0 here...

   https://github.com/openstack/monasca-api/blob/2d84109db10a775aa47b2f5ce9e551a2ae3bc45b/monasca_api/common/repositories/influxdb/metrics_repository.py#L66

   ...set self._build_serie_{dimension_values,metric_list} to two wrapper methods.

2) In each wrapper method we...

   a) retry _init_serie_builders()
   b) check if self._build_serie_{dimension_values,metric_list} is still that same wrapper method
   c1) raise an exception that causes an error 500 if it is the wrapper method
   c2) call self._build_serie_{dimension_values,metric_list} normally and return its result if it isn't the wrapper method"}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > 
 > ...set self._build_serie_{dimension_values,metric_list} to two
 > wrapper methods.


I would do that only when ConnectionError or ConnectionTimeout are caught as already proposed here.'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 16:33:06.000000000', 'message': "treat influxdb connection problems as critical errors

When determining influxdb version, the code relies on results of
SHOW DIAGNOSTICS. It is unknown when version banner appeared in
the output of the query, so in case we can't find it there the
version is assumed to be < 0.10.

However, it is incorrect to assume that any error means that
the version is < 0.10. Sometimes error means that influxdb is not
ready to serve connections yet. In this case the application should
error, as in any other case when backend is not available.

Change-Id: I813201e0410150cb9c81117232ac3986423e7503
Story: 2001313
"}, {'created': '2017-12-06 11:50:02.000000000', 'message': "retry connection to influxdb if it is not available

When determining influxdb version, the code relies on results of
SHOW DIAGNOSTICS. It is unknown when version banner appeared in
the output of the query, so in case we can't find it there the
version is assumed to be < 0.10.

However, it is incorrect to assume that any error means that
the version is < 0.10. Sometimes error means that influxdb is not
ready to serve connections yet.

Retry connection to influxdb with 10 seconds time out, logging
an error about it.

Change-Id: I813201e0410150cb9c81117232ac3986423e7503
Story: 2001313
"}, {'created': '2017-12-07 13:34:54.000000000', 'message': "retry connection to influxdb if it is not available

When determining influxdb version, the code relies on results of
SHOW DIAGNOSTICS. It is unknown when version banner appeared in
the output of the query, so in case we can't find it there the
version is assumed to be < 0.10.

However, it is incorrect to assume that any error means that
the version is < 0.10. Sometimes error means that influxdb is not
ready to serve connections yet.

Retry connection to influxdb on each request if it was not
running when monasca-api started.

Change-Id: I813201e0410150cb9c81117232ac3986423e7503

"}, {'created': '2017-12-08 13:32:17.000000000', 'message': "determine influxdb version on each request if required

When determining influxdb version, the code relies on results of
SHOW DIAGNOSTICS. It is unknown when version banner appeared in
the output of the query, so in case we can't find it there the
version is assumed to be < 0.10.

However, it is incorrect to assume that any error means that
the version is < 0.10. Sometimes error means that influxdb is not
ready to serve connections yet. Ignoring these errors leads to
incorrect state of the application.

Try determining version of influxdb on application startup.
If it fails, retry the attempt on each request.

Change-Id: I813201e0410150cb9c81117232ac3986423e7503
Story: 2001313
Task: 5867
"}]
commit_message:
determine influxdb version on each request if required

When determining influxdb version, the code relies on results of
SHOW DIAGNOSTICS. It is unknown when version banner appeared in
the output of the query, so in case we can't find it there the
version is assumed to be < 0.10.

However, it is incorrect to assume that any error means that
the version is < 0.10. Sometimes error means that influxdb is not
ready to serve connections yet. Ignoring these errors leads to
incorrect state of the application.

Try determining version of influxdb on application startup.
If it fails, retry the attempt on each request.

Change-Id: I813201e0410150cb9c81117232ac3986423e7503
Story: 2001313

commit_message:
Derive Params failure message format change

This change is to filter the empty messages of roles which are
success and displays only the failure messages with
corresponding roles which are failed.

Change-Id: I3946c4c253994b92e44fb6be5d13972b72071261
Closes-Bug: #1714476

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 08:41:35.000000000', 'message': "Second stage call fails with Internal server error

When user calls stage command again then it fails with 500 internal
server error. This is because after stage call image status changes
to 'uploading' and for second call it again tries to set status to
'uploading' and fails with 'InvalidImageStatusTransition: Image
status transition from uploading to uploading is not allowed'
exception which is not caught at the controller side.

Caught 'InvalidImageStatusTransition' and return 409 HTTPConflict
resonse status.

Change-Id: Ie66d3e3474b38b2f6c8d31f5c1fb252d45cbd3c9
Closes-Bug: #1733274
"}, {'created': '2017-11-21 08:33:19.000000000', 'message': "Stage call fails with Internal server error

1. When user calls stage command again then it fails with 500 internal
server error. This is because after stage call image status changes
to 'uploading' and for second call it again tries to set status to
'uploading' and fails with 'InvalidImageStatusTransition: Image
status transition from uploading to uploading is not allowed'
exception which is not caught at the controller side.

2. If image upload (/file call) is in progress image is in saving
state at that time. If user tries to make a /stage call on same image
then it returns 500 internal server error as Image transition from
saving to uploading is not allowed.

Caught 'InvalidImageStatusTransition' and return 409 HTTPConflict
resonse status.

Closes-Bug: #1733274

commit_message:
Fix 500 from duplicate stage call

1. When user calls stage command again then it fails with 500 internal
server error. This is because after stage call image status changes
to 'uploading' and for second call it again tries to set status to
'uploading' and fails with 'InvalidImageStatusTransition: Image
status transition from uploading to uploading is not allowed'
exception which is not caught at the controller side.

2. If image upload (/file call) is in progress image is in saving
state at that time. If user tries to make a /stage call on same image
then it returns 500 internal server error as Image transition from
saving to uploading is not allowed.

Caught 'InvalidImageStatusTransition' and return 409 HTTPConflict
resonse status.

Change-Id: Ie66d3e3474b38b2f6c8d31f5c1fb252d45cbd3c9
Closes-Bug: #1733274
Closes-Bug: #1733512

subject: Add 'stage_image' policy
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 12:23:57.000000000', 'message': "Add 'stage_image' policy

On the current master the 'upload_image' policy which is
same for both image upload (PUT /v2/images/{image_id}/file)
and image import (POST /v2/images/{image_id}/import) API.

So to resolve this new policy 'import_image' is introduce in [1].

But the problem is that policy 'import_image' will allow
a user to make the PUT .../stage call to stage some data,
but then that user won't be able to do anything with it.
So it's better to have a stage_image policy to govern
whether a user can put data into the stage.

This patch introduces a new policy, 'stage_image', that determines
whether a user can make stage API call.

Closes-Bug: #1732141
Change-Id: I0d5daff015a47b4a0d37bc61c8117f2bbe8546b0
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'stage_image' policy

On the current master the 'upload_image' policy which is
same for both image upload (PUT /v2/images/{image_id}/file)
and image import (POST /v2/images/{image_id}/import) API.

So to resolve this new policy 'import_image' is introduce in [1].

But the problem is that policy 'import_image' will allow
a user to make the PUT .../stage call to stage some data,
but then that user won't be able to do anything with it.
So it's better to have a stage_image policy to govern
whether a user can put data into the stage.

This patch introduces a new policy, 'stage_image', that determines
whether a user can make stage API call.

Closes-Bug: #1732141
Change-Id: I0d5daff015a47b4a0d37bc61c8117f2bbe8546b0

commit_message:
Add option to set the check port

The option to set the checkport is needed when trying to balance traffic
to a service that uses a secondary port to verify service availability.
This is being implemented to support galera which should be using an
HTTP based check to verify sync status instead of a simple mysql login.
For reference this is what the folks at Percona are recommending [0].

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html
Closes-Bug: #1665667

Change-Id: I81c924464aa4b19c2a62f37b5bf26c3c0453786a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 09:10:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation to check VLANs against switch info in Ironic intospection data

This adds a validation to check the VLANs configured in nic config files
against the Ironic introspection data for all nodes.  The introspection process
receives LLDP packets from network switches and stores data including
VLANs, LAG, MTU etc. for all switch ports in the introspection data.
The introspection data in swift is accessed by this validation.

This runs during pre-deployment and, as such, the scheduling of
roles to actual baremetal nodes has not been done yet, so VLANs
cannot be compared against particular switch ports.  This validation
is useful to detect if VLANs have been defined in the template files
but have not been configured on the switch on any switch ports.

A follow-on post-deployment validation can be developed to compare
the VLANs on each role against the switch port VLANs, along with
confirming that bonds are correctly configured on the switch etc.

Change-Id: I5adeefea1534db0ede6993596a0b5d37829f914a
(cherry picked from commit 7d32cff48458c4282bdc86921444e20f4517b298)
'}]
commit_message:
Add validation to check VLANs against switch info in Ironic intospection data

This adds a validation to check the VLANs configured in nic config files
against the Ironic introspection data for all nodes.  The introspection process
receives LLDP packets from network switches and stores data including
VLANs, LAG, MTU etc. for all switch ports in the introspection data.
The introspection data in swift is accessed by this validation.

This runs during pre-deployment and, as such, the scheduling of
roles to actual baremetal nodes has not been done yet, so VLANs
cannot be compared against particular switch ports.  This validation
is useful to detect if VLANs have been defined in the template files
but have not been configured on the switch on any switch ports.

A follow-on post-deployment validation can be developed to compare
the VLANs on each role against the switch port VLANs, along with
confirming that bonds are correctly configured on the switch etc.

Change-Id: I5adeefea1534db0ede6993596a0b5d37829f914a
(cherry picked from commit 7d32cff48458c4282bdc86921444e20f4517b298)

Change-Id: Iaa7e9f854901381033ca70a1c4f39fe64226adab

commit_message:
rabbitmq: Avoid calls to rabbitmqctl during fast-forward upgrades

Ansible outputs are generated for fast-forward upgrades by updating the
overcloud stack with a new version of tripleo-heat-templates. At
present, this stack update leads to puppet-tripleo attempting to use
rabbitmqctl during the final deployment to containers while the
rabbitmq-server services itself is offline.

This change avoids this by simply verifying that stack_update_type is
not equal to FASTFORWARDUPGRADE. A new manage_user parameter is also
introduced to override this check, allowing puppet-tripleo users to
explicitly request for the user to be updated.

Change-Id: Iaa7e9f854901381033ca70a1c4f39fe64226adab

commit_message:
Fix systemd init template for program override

The systemd-init template was not looking at the program_override
variable within each service's dictionary.

This also fixes glance-api so that it's running under uWSGI when the v1
API is disabled. Creating images from a remote URL is exclusive to the
v1 API and does not work when glance-api is run under uWSGI.

The libxml2-dev package is required by uWSGI and has been added to the
distro package list.

Additional options have been added to the uWSGI configuration to better
support requests containing chunked data (image uploads).

Change-Id: I14f3162a4666d770beec9746469021466fa4d449

[{'created': '2017-10-30 21:53:42.000000000', 'message': 'Protect prepare_update_replace() with resource lock

When we consolidated resource locking with resource state transitions in
a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023, prepare_update_replace() moved
outside of the locked section, so that other update operations could
potentially conflict with it. This change ensures that we call it while the
lock is still held (if we have transitioned the resource to
UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, and thus acquired the lock), or that we acquire the
lock before calling it (if UpdateReplace is raised before attempting to
update the resource).

To avoid unnecessary locking and unlocking, we only take the lock if the
Resource plugin has overridden the default handler method (either
restore_prev_rsrc() or prepare_for_replace()), since the defaults do
nothing.

Change-Id: Ie32836ed643e440143bde8b83aeb4d6159acd034
Closes-Bug: #1727127

commit_message:
Protect prepare_update_replace() with resource lock

When we consolidated resource locking with resource state transitions in
a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023, prepare_update_replace() moved
outside of the locked section, so that other update operations could
potentially conflict with it. This change ensures that we call it while the
lock is still held (if we have transitioned the resource to
UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, and thus acquired the lock), or that we acquire the
lock before calling it (if UpdateReplace is raised before attempting to
update the resource).

To avoid unnecessary locking and unlocking, we only take the lock if the
Resource plugin has overridden the default handler method (either
restore_prev_rsrc() or prepare_for_replace()), since the defaults do
nothing.

Change-Id: Ie32836ed643e440143bde8b83aeb4d6159acd034
Closes-Bug: #1727127

commit_message:
Remove deprecated 'forbid_global_implied_dsr' feature flag

'forbid_global_implied_dsr' feature flag was added for Mitaka
and older branches which are not supported now.

Devstack already removed this feature flag setting
- Ia1eb87d68a6265d8541cb87a88523246885e5a8a

This commit removes this from tempest.

Change-Id: I5422e33867a6038e8a4782dbdc639434a3c2b4b6

commit_message:
Document the real behavior of notify_on_state_change

The documentation of the notify_on_state_change config param was
incomplete and misleading. The code is untouched since
2012 so the document is updated to reflect the current behavior.

Change-Id: I51d0deffc4f42ff2722a8d21aa6b8c8008c62723
Closes-Bug: #1535254
(cherry picked from commit e86604fb6579e2333ab9ab5a6926ef84d201152a)

commit_message:
Convert charm to Python 3 only

* Needed to add a swift_manager/manager.py file which uses the payload
  software python modules to perform certain functions on behalf of the
  charm.  These were part of the main charm, which couldn't be retained
  in the charm due to the charm changing to Py3.
* Changed to absolute imports using the charm root as the root for all
  charm modules.
* The py2 target in tox.ini is used to test the swift_manager/manager.py
  file only.
* The .testr.conf file has been migrated to .stestr.conf

Change-Id: If37a393aa6ed27651b04810aa0bbf69eda37d7b4

commit_message:
Add a new UndercloudHomeDir parameter

Add a parameter to control the homedir of the
Undercloud user. Useful if you don't want stackrc
and ssh creds in /root/

Change-Id: I2ad703689b600280b2c1ab1752654f2d334cb6db
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make more CI jobs voting

A recent regression showed up in the tempest tests, but as they were not
voting it was ignored and not spotted until later. This caused lots of
time to be wasted debugging.

We should make more of the jobs voting and fix any instability (or
remove particular tests that are unstable).

Related-Bug: #1736685
Change-Id: Ifd6f1d659db06bca3e6417b9235258fd02f1da88

[{'created': '2017-09-04 06:15:27.000000000', 'message': 'OSProfiler Intergration

1. connect_string store in deployment and get in credential
2. if has got connect_string and hmac_key,rally get osprofiler data and process them in osprofilerchart
3. new js code will receive the data from osprofiler chart and generate graphs

Change-Id: Id477a10489102425fae79ecf6719b1e0739e92c0
'}, {'created': '2017-09-04 06:38:24.000000000', 'message': 'OSProfiler Intergration

1. connect_string store in deployment and get in credential

commit_message:
OSProfiler Intergration

1. connect_string store in deployment and get in credential
2. if has got connect_string and hmac_key,rally get osprofiler data
   and process them in osprofilerchart
3. new js code will receive the data from osprofiler chart and
   generate graphs

Change-Id: Id477a10489102425fae79ecf6719b1e0739e92c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 13:06:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tempest plugins installation

The conditional was wrong, and therefore always skipped.
When you have registered the output of with items, you get the
whole list in _registered_var.results.

Each item is the result itself, and for convenience, ansible
throws in the original item under the dict "item".

So here original item's repo in the results should be in
_registered_var.results[0].item.repo while the stat of the folder
should be in _registered_var.results[0].stat.<whatever>.

Replace _registered_var.results[::] with item and you get your
conditional. Magic!

Change-Id: I44acb420155d3bc09b271a4b2fa92b488aae4c89
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest plugins installation

The conditional was wrong, and therefore always skipped.
When you have registered the output of with items, you get the
whole list in _registered_var.results.

Each item is the result itself, and for convenience, ansible
throws in the original item under the dict "item".

So here original item's repo in the results should be in
_registered_var.results[0].item.repo while the stat of the folder
should be in _registered_var.results[0].stat.<whatever>.

Replace _registered_var.results[::] with item and you get your
conditional. Magic!

Change-Id: I44acb420155d3bc09b271a4b2fa92b488aae4c89

commit_message:
Allow reserved status for attach check

This issue was due to Nova changes it's volume attach workflow
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330285) which allows `reserved`
status.
Closes-Bug: #1737343

Change-Id: I13f1906f53a89586bb51c0b70fa768a9500dfa26

commit_message:
Add -dlm to the tempest job name

networking-generic-switch-tempest-dsvm is the only job on gates
that tests DLM integration feature of n-g-s,
so add '-dlm' suffix to it for more clarity.

Conflicts:
  zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: I55ef2bdfa75d280e5299aae821aa9584aa863f38
(cherry picked from commit 3f85557930ca066bb4a1a0945de81e76224a848c)

[{'created': '2017-12-08 20:38:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove LXC yum repo from containers

Ths LXC yum repository is being added to containers during the
cach prep step on CentOS. This causes delays/failures in the
containers and it's only needed on hosts.

Closes-Bug: 1737202
Change-Id: I3fdc313a43daae938357230cf99e2992ede11e01
(cherry picked from commit 84c08cfe94ace0c5e753e14e7e8512a0a88abbb1)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove LXC yum repo from containers

Ths LXC yum repository is being added to containers during the
cach prep step on CentOS. This causes delays/failures in the
containers and it's only needed on hosts.

Closes-Bug: 1737202
Change-Id: I3fdc313a43daae938357230cf99e2992ede11e01
(cherry picked from commit 84c08cfe94ace0c5e753e14e7e8512a0a88abbb1)

commit_message:
Extend the cinder lvm thin pool with new devices

If a new device is added to the block-device configuration option
then add the new device to the cinder thin pool if it exists.

From pike+ if the lvm backend is being used then it defaults to
using a thin provisioning pool. This patch makes sure any new
devices are used to extend that pool.

Change-Id: I851e4eb58dbdc122086d53fe346ea045c6044f50

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 10:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify create_network of OVNClient

Args physnet and segid are legacy args and they do not bring any
optimization benefits right now.
This patch gets them directly from network and removes unnecessary
_get_attribute method.

Change-Id: I762e0a297a7e3a9ca32c64c63f226859e8c1ed0c
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify create_network of OVNClient

Args physnet and segid are legacy args and they do not bring any
optimization benefits right now.
This patch gets them directly from network and removes unnecessary
_get_attribute method.

Change-Id: I762e0a297a7e3a9ca32c64c63f226859e8c1ed0c
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Add vitrage-dbsync to extend_start.sh of vitrage-api image

According to this line[1], dbsync command needs to be added to
the extend_start.sh file of vitrage-api image.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L139

Change-Id: If30dc5c761ef6164b68afe217ee85c167e73d236
Closes-Bug: #1736927

internal endpoint to v3 for Pike onwards.

commit_message:
Add DockerDebug

Implement a mechanism to enable docker service debug logging.
If DockerDebug is unset defaults to the normal Debug parameter
setting.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 11:16:30.000000000', 'message': "Installl OpenSSH by default

This is needed to produce a more unified ramdisk that can be
used for ansible-deploy with minimal rebuild

changes include:
- deprecate ENABLE_SSH var, split it to INSTALL_SSH and AUTHORIZE_SSH
  - INSTALL_SSH (defaults to true) installs and configures OpenSSH
    server
  - AUTHORIZE_SSH (defaults to false) adds SSH_PUBLIC_KEY as authorized
    for 'tc' user and makes some other changes
- symlink all from '/usr/local/(s)bin' to '/usr/(s)bin'
- adds a new script 'add-ssh-tinyipa' and 'addssh' make target
  - this effectively does those parts that finalise-tinyipa.sh script
    would do when AUTHORIZE_SSH is enabled
  - this make target will be used in gate jobs for ansible deploy
    interface

Change-Id: Ib6fcd5bbd7e79b9df83b660441dd685b1b17be62
Related-Bug: #1526308

commit_message:
Installl OpenSSH by default

This is needed to produce a more unified ramdisk that can be
used for ansible-deploy with minimal rebuild

changes include:
- deprecate ENABLE_SSH var, split it to INSTALL_SSH and AUTHORIZE_SSH
  - INSTALL_SSH (defaults to true) installs and configures OpenSSH
    server
  - AUTHORIZE_SSH (defaults to false) adds SSH_PUBLIC_KEY as authorized
    for 'tc' user and makes some other changes
- symlink all from '/usr/local/(s)bin' to '/usr/(s)bin'
- adds a new script 'add-ssh-tinyipa' and 'addssh' make target
  - this effectively does those parts that finalise-tinyipa.sh script
    would do when AUTHORIZE_SSH is enabled
  - this make target will be used in gate jobs for ansible deploy
    interface

Change-Id: Ib6fcd5bbd7e79b9df83b660441dd685b1b17be62
Related-Bug: #1526308

commit_message:
Provide bindep_profile in openstack-tox job setup

Oslo.messaging uses a single bindep.txt to define common
and driver dependencies. The bindep_profile is used by the
bindep role to select the driver specific packages.

This patch:
* Add bindep_profile var to jobs
* Add kafka dependencies
* update test-setup for use by amqp1

Depends-On: I6beb7b07a7dbc345e63e758ebbc86400e0ee16d3
Change-Id: Ib552152e841a9fc0bffdcb7c3f7bc75613d0ed62

commit_message:
Add per-network bind ips to inventory

This adds the per-node per-network ips for each network so we
can e.g set the bind ips for services deployed via ansible.

commit_message:
Add env var for custom ssh user

W/o an env var, a dynamic inventory can't be invoked for a custom
user. Ansible uses the same ANSIBLE_SSH_USER so the value will
be aligned to both.

Related-bug: #1734298

Change-Id: Ieddbb4c87d88888f78d494ff670db907bce4fd78
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change controller ulimit to match the default

The default limit for file descriptors is 1024 so this validations
would fail when run with the default settings.

Change-Id: I7053ea0f56fa620ddccc8dcbc31f6cc98249abc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 09:00:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix binary name

Before an upgrade, we have these type of entries in the db.

MariaDB [nova]> SELECT id, host, `binary`, deleted, version FROM services;
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
| id | host         | binary             | deleted | version |
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
|  5 | r1-n-os-api  | nova-osapi_compute | 0       |      16 |
| 21 | r1-n-m-api   | nova-metadata      | 0       |      16 |

The wsgi files we run basically boil down to something like

  NAME=metadata
  return wsgi_app.init_application(NAME)

In the wsgi_app.py we see this function

  service_ref = objects.Service.get_by_host_and_binary(ctxt, host, name)

Which results in a really big query, which again comes down to

  SELECT host, `binary` FROM services
    WHERE host = 'r1-n-m-api' AND `binary` == 'metadata'

No results. service_ref is set to None. Carry on.

  if service_ref:
    #Nope.
  else:
    try:
      ...
      service_obj.host = host
      service_obj.binary = 'nova-%s' % name
      service_obj.create()

Which results in a INSERT statement something like this;

  INSERT INTO services(host, `binary`, report_count, disabled, deleted, version)
    VALUES ('r1-n-m-api', 'nova-metadata', 0, 0, 0, 22)

  ERROR 1062 (23000): Duplicate entry 'r1-n-m-api-nova-metadata-0' for key 'uniq_services0host0binary0deleted'

So the first suggested fix is to prepend 'nova-' to the name, and make both
queries ask for 'nova-metadata'.  There's also a check that it doesn't start
with 'nova-', incase someone decides to prepend 'nova-' to the NAME= in the
wsgi-file. Which migth be a litte overkill, but just a safeguard none the less.

Change-Id: I58cf9a0115a98c78e5d2fb57c41c13ba6fac0fad
Closes-bug: 1715463
(cherry picked from commit 0b4a021e4224981e83dca67e7519458f9939f3cd)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix binary name

Before an upgrade, we have these type of entries in the db.

MariaDB [nova]> SELECT id, host, `binary`, deleted, version FROM services;
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
| id | host         | binary             | deleted | version |
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
|  5 | r1-n-os-api  | nova-osapi_compute | 0       |      16 |
| 21 | r1-n-m-api   | nova-metadata      | 0       |      16 |

The wsgi files we run basically boil down to something like

  NAME=metadata
  return wsgi_app.init_application(NAME)

In the wsgi_app.py we see this function

  service_ref = objects.Service.get_by_host_and_binary(ctxt, host, name)

Which results in a really big query, which again comes down to

  SELECT host, `binary` FROM services
    WHERE host = 'r1-n-m-api' AND `binary` == 'metadata'

No results. service_ref is set to None. Carry on.

  if service_ref:
    #Nope.
  else:
    try:
      ...
      service_obj.host = host
      service_obj.binary = 'nova-%s' % name
      service_obj.create()

Which results in a INSERT statement something like this;

  INSERT INTO services(host, `binary`, report_count, disabled, deleted, version)
    VALUES ('r1-n-m-api', 'nova-metadata', 0, 0, 0, 22)

  ERROR 1062 (23000): Duplicate entry 'r1-n-m-api-nova-metadata-0' for key 'uniq_services0host0binary0deleted'

So the first suggested fix is to prepend 'nova-' to the name, and make both
queries ask for 'nova-metadata'.  There's also a check that it doesn't start
with 'nova-', incase someone decides to prepend 'nova-' to the NAME= in the
wsgi-file. Which migth be a litte overkill, but just a safeguard none the less.

Change-Id: I58cf9a0115a98c78e5d2fb57c41c13ba6fac0fad
Closes-bug: 1715463
(cherry picked from commit 0b4a021e4224981e83dca67e7519458f9939f3cd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 18:05:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation to check VLANs against switch info in Ironic intospection data

This adds a validation to check the VLANs configured in nic config files
against the Ironic introspection data for all nodes.  The introspection process
receives LLDP packets from network switches and stores data including
VLANs, LAG, MTU etc. for all switch ports in the introspection data.
The introspection data in swift is accessed by this validation.

This runs during pre-deployment and, as such, the scheduling of
roles to actual baremetal nodes has not been done yet, so VLANs
cannot be compared against particular switch ports.  This validation
is useful to detect if VLANs have been defined in the template files
but have not been configured on the switch on any switch ports.

A follow-on post-deployment validation can be developed to compare
the VLANs on each role against the switch port VLANs, along with
confirming that bonds are correctly configured on the switch etc.

Change-Id: I5adeefea1534db0ede6993596a0b5d37829f914a
'}, {'created': '2017-10-23 22:08:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation to check VLANs against switch info in Ironic intospection data

commit_message:
Add validation to check VLANs against switch info in Ironic intospection data

This adds a validation to check the VLANs configured in nic config files
against the Ironic introspection data for all nodes.  The introspection process
receives LLDP packets from network switches and stores data including
VLANs, LAG, MTU etc. for all switch ports in the introspection data.
The introspection data in swift is accessed by this validation.

This runs during pre-deployment and, as such, the scheduling of
roles to actual baremetal nodes has not been done yet, so VLANs
cannot be compared against particular switch ports.  This validation
is useful to detect if VLANs have been defined in the template files
but have not been configured on the switch on any switch ports.

A follow-on post-deployment validation can be developed to compare
the VLANs on each role against the switch port VLANs, along with
confirming that bonds are correctly configured on the switch etc.

Change-Id: I5adeefea1534db0ede6993596a0b5d37829f914a
