revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 16:10:15.000000000', 'message': "storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

When a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
that have decided to catch 'ValueError: invalid interpolation syntax'
and return the url as-is. While it does not work with the builtin python
ConfigParser that raise the expcetion.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config and oslo.config have
chosen this weird behavior, we have to escape the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711

commit_message:
storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

oslo.config doesn't support %{} or %() variable interpolation while
ConfigParser does.

So when a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
But the Python ConfigParser will raise the exception.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config, we have to escape
the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-09 14:57:50.000000000', 'message': 'Classify plugin registry into official and non-official projects

There are several cases where it is easy to know horizon plugins
from official project teams. For example, we sometimes would like to
know translation support, release models, and so on.
Changes in the official project teams happen less frequently,
so I think it would be okay to maintain the plugin list in horizon repo.

Change-Id: I5a31cf50d9884d344ab6fcd6ecf3fea7e4f461a1
'}]
commit_message:
Classify plugin registry into official and non-official projects

There are several cases where it is easy to know horizon plugins
from official project teams. For example, we sometimes would like to
know translation support, release models, and so on.
Changes in the official project teams happen less frequently,
so I think it would be okay to maintain the plugin list in horizon repo.

Change-Id: I5a31cf50d9884d344ab6fcd6ecf3fea7e4f461a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 18:04:00.000000000', 'message': "Change the galera health check for better cluster health

The current galera cluster health check simply logs into a cluster node
but does not check if the node is sync'd. This can lead to an issue
where a node is placed back into the pool before it is ready. If this
happens it can lead to a broken OpenStack environment until the wsrep
received queue is processed which is especially true if the node out of
sync happens to be the primary.

Change-Id: I49e371a2743618a0b5544a23e892aa28bb8567eb
Closes-Bug: #1665667
Depends-On: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Change the galera health check for better cluster health

The current galera cluster health check simply logs into a cluster node
but does not check if the node is sync'd. This can lead to an issue
where a node is placed back into the pool before it is ready. If this
happens it can lead to a broken OpenStack environment until the wsrep
received queue is processed which is especially true if the node out of
sync happens to be the primary.

Change-Id: I49e371a2743618a0b5544a23e892aa28bb8567eb
Closes-Bug: #1665667
Depends-On: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96
Depends-On: I81c924464aa4b19c2a62f37b5bf26c3c0453786a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix floatingip creation in test_l3
messages:
[{'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

For me it looks good but would be good if Brian and Miguel could check it as L3 experts :)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-12-08 01:58:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Only the network id is required in the request:

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#floating-ips-floatingips

So passing the additional information isn't necessary.  Maybe you had some changes in your repo that caused the failure, since otherwise this test would be failing all the time."}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2017-12-09 14:21:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yeah, I also test with this. Just as Brain said. And I also suspect that this may be related with create floatingip with a non-fixed ip port. But current neutron server return the valid response.
neutron floatingip-create --port-id f92bdc54-5d55-4403-9a19-16038b6a7615 public
neutron CLI is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use openstack CLI instead.
Bad floatingip request: Cannot add floating IP to port f92bdc54-5d55-4403-9a19-16038b6a7615 that has no fixed IPv4 addresses.
Neutron server returns request_ids: ['req-e9abe0df-4ed6-4edf-9bbd-cd31df3439a7']"}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2017-12-11 07:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Brain and ZhaoBo, maybe this should fix with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/, I made some changes in my repo, sorry for misleading.'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2017-12-11 08:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is a related fix in [1], but it seems unnecessary.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 12:57:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix floatingip creation in test_l3

While creating floatingip, we should pass subnet or ip_address,
otherwise it will fails.

Change-Id: I52cd9ab98e00d5e649a98470b01791e3c709f80d
Closes-Bug: #1736755
'}]
commit_message:
Fix floatingip creation in test_l3

While creating floatingip, we should pass subnet or ip_address,
otherwise it will fails.

Change-Id: I52cd9ab98e00d5e649a98470b01791e3c709f80d
Closes-Bug: #1736755

Release notes should be created automatically by the docs creation tool.
Having them in the tree (and in index.rst) breaks RPM packaging.

Change-Id: I24733ce7fab557aa0e288e9b021f0d43a338c06e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove release notes from docs

Release notes should be created automatically by the docs creation tool.
Having them in the tree (and in index.rst) breaks RPM packaging.

Change-Id: I24733ce7fab557aa0e288e9b021f0d43a338c06e

commit_message:
zuul: add irrelevant-files section to job

This adds the 'irrelevant-files' section to the blazar-devstack-dsvm
job. If all the changes are in this list, the job is not run.

Change-Id: I2de90e7131d726cdadb9bab29c1a155d65e9ed1d

commit_message:
Ensure rsyncd PID file is removed during overcloud updates

During an overcloud update it might happen that the rsyncd container
gets killed & restarted, leaving a PID file from rsyncd. rsyncd won't
start because of this, which results in a container restarting loop.

This patch ensures the PID file is absent to fix this.

Closes-Bug: 1734674
Change-Id: Ie5b28005f1079e432cfca6c31d28295174e06986

'}, {'created': '2017-12-08 16:40:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add mistral-extra to global requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  It will be maintained by the mistral core team.

- Is the library good code?

  It is reasonable, but currently lacking much content. The plan is to
  expand the repository to become a "Actions library" for Mistral. We
  will follow standard OpenStack development practices.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  Yes, Mistral itself will optionally depend on it and TripleO will also
  depend on it.

- If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does
  it use the `cycle-with-intermediary` release type?

  It is currently `cycle-with-milestones` - I believe we will need to
  change this. mistral-extra is currently released with mistral and
  mistral-dashboard.

Change-Id: I2973d588901afab88809f2fb4f6d288e842984f7
'}]
commit_message:
Add mistral-extra to global requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  It will be maintained by the mistral core team.

- Is the library good code?

  It is reasonable, but currently lacking much content. The plan is to
  expand the repository to become a "Actions library" for Mistral. We
  will follow standard OpenStack development practices.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  Yes, Mistral itself will optionally depend on it and TripleO will also
  depend on it.

- If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does
  it use the `cycle-with-intermediary` release type?

  It is currently `cycle-with-milestones` - I believe we will need to
  change this. mistral-extra is currently released with mistral and
  mistral-dashboard.

Change-Id: I2973d588901afab88809f2fb4f6d288e842984f7

commit_message:
Add the missing murano package files                                                                                                                                                                                                          

When enable Murano, kolla-ansible will import the io.murano.applications.zip
file[1]. But Murano container doesn't symlink this file. This patch is
to add the missing link.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/murano/tasks/start.yml#L69

Change-Id: Id791fc39e1f5136add7d10db291cbdba59d1c291
Closes-Bug: #1734019

[{'account_id': 26569, 'date': '2017-12-05 07:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-05 07:26:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 26569, 'date': '2017-12-05 07:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

consolidade all commands into a single transaction.

subject: Pass located tests directory in oslo debug
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 02:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I7aebca74e505558ff6b247f6ca9e2795fcf8ffb9
'}]
commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I7aebca74e505558ff6b247f6ca9e2795fcf8ffb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-22 18:12:19.000000000', 'message': 'Increase the timeout for creating container

The default timeout is 60 seconds, which might not be enough for
pulling down docker image from DockerHub. There are several
intermittent gate failure due to that. This patch increases the
timeout to 120 seconds.

Change-Id: Ifc0b803ffd0c0294b544dec9f5ccc8bca603ddb4
'}]
commit_message:
Increase the timeout for creating container

The default timeout is 60 seconds, which might not be enough for
pulling down docker image from DockerHub. There are several
intermittent gate failure due to that. This patch increases the
timeout to 120 seconds.

Change-Id: Ifc0b803ffd0c0294b544dec9f5ccc8bca603ddb4

commit_message:
Remove legacy jobs from puppet openstack modules

All puppet openstack modules switch to Zuul v3 testing, for example:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+topic:zuulv3+puppet

Change-Id: Ic58f542efde7071a4750aa820b21f9dcddc0cc85

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-11 03:36:04.000000000', 'message': 'placement: adds REST API for nested providers

Adds a new microversion (1.1) to the placement REST API for supporting
nested resource provider attributes (root_provider_uuid and
parent_provider_uuid). Clients for the placement REST API can specify
either OpenStack-API-Version: placement 1.1 or placement latest to
handle the nested resource providers attributes.

Change-Id: I4db74e4dc682bc03df6ec94cd1c3a5f5dc927a7b
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

"}, {'created': '2017-10-10 17:09:13.000000000', 'message': 'placement: adds REST API for nested providers

Adds a new microversion (1.11) to the placement REST API for supporting
nested resource providers.

For POST /resource_providers and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}, a new
optional 'parent_provider_uuid' field is added to the request payload.

For GET /resource_providers/{uuid} responses, the
'parent_provider_uuid' field and a convenience field called
'root_provider_uuid' are provided.

For GET /resource_providers, a new '?tree=<rp_uuid>' parameter is
supported. This parameter accepts a UUID of a resource provider. This
will cause the resulting list of resource providers to be only the
providers within the same "provider tree" as the provider identified by
<rp_uuid>

Clients for the placement REST API can specify either
'OpenStack-API-Version: placement 1.11' or 'placement latest' to handle
the new 'parent_provider_uuid' attribute and to query for resource
providers in a provider tree.

Change-Id: I4db74e4dc682bc03df6ec94cd1c3a5f5dc927a7b
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
APIImpact
'}, {'created': '2017-10-11 01:17:35.000000000', 'message': 'placement: adds REST API for nested providers

'}, {'created': '2017-10-11 18:10:51.000000000', 'message': 'placement: adds REST API for nested providers

Adds a new microversion (1.11) to the placement REST API for supporting
nested resource providers.

For POST /resource_providers and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}, a new
optional 'parent_provider_uuid' field is added to the request payload.

For GET /resource_providers/{uuid} responses, the
'parent_provider_uuid' field and a convenience field called
'root_provider_uuid' are provided.

For GET /resource_providers, a new '?tree=<rp_uuid>' parameter is
supported. This parameter accepts a UUID of a resource provider. This
will cause the resulting list of resource providers to be only the
providers within the same "provider tree" as the provider identified by
<rp_uuid>

Clients for the placement REST API can specify either
'OpenStack-API-Version: placement 1.11' or 'placement latest' to handle
the new 'parent_provider_uuid' attribute and to query for resource
providers in a provider tree.

Change-Id: I4db74e4dc682bc03df6ec94cd1c3a5f5dc927a7b
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
APIImpact

commit_message:
placement: adds REST API for nested providers

Adds a new microversion (1.14) to the placement REST API for supporting
nested resource providers.

For POST /resource_providers and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}, a new
optional 'parent_provider_uuid' field is added to the request payload.

For GET /resource_providers/{uuid} responses, the
'parent_provider_uuid' field and a convenience field called
'root_provider_uuid' are provided.

For GET /resource_providers, a new '?in_tree=<rp_uuid>' parameter is
supported. This parameter accepts a UUID of a resource provider. This
will cause the resulting list of resource providers to be only the
providers within the same "provider tree" as the provider identified by
<rp_uuid>

Clients for the placement REST API can specify either
'OpenStack-API-Version: placement 1.14' or 'placement latest' to handle
the new 'parent_provider_uuid' attribute and to query for resource
providers in a provider tree.

Change-Id: I4db74e4dc682bc03df6ec94cd1c3a5f5dc927a7b
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
APIImpact

commit_message:
HPE 3PAR: Handle single path in FC configuration

Issue :- With single path configuration, after
volume attach multiple vluns were created,
intead of one vlun.

Added check to create host with single initiator,
which will use single target wwn to create a vlun

Change-Id: I64cfe5853cc728af5a9bbe8774f024b4e06b77e0
Closes-Bug: #1727176

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 06:39:32.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ifcc108dc4f91fcdf1d9d4c21ed8ad2983c7ff2c1

and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ifcc108dc4f91fcdf1d9d4c21ed8ad2983c7ff2c1
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ifcc108dc4f91fcdf1d9d4c21ed8ad2983c7ff2c1

subject: Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 02:45:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

Change-Id: I364faf329e0487323fa2223fb4b2a744dec964e1
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

Change-Id: I364faf329e0487323fa2223fb4b2a744dec964e1

commit_message:
Fix whitelist_file's regex construction with regex

In regex_builder-> construct_regex, whitelist_file's regex
is being appended with regex if any but should be ORed.

Also updating the help message for --regex.

Change-Id: Ic05c6d1d7a638a4728c7387d0e00153fbcae8e83
Closes-Bug: #1595119

ML2 plugin.

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I226346ec50e4433302591ddaccded1edfa9f483a
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
[docker] Fix configuration

* fix lable of database section. it should be [database] instead of [db]
* create `/home/rally/data` dir by rally user instead of root, so rally
  could operate the database there.
* modify the volume path
* update the docs

Change-Id: Ia4df80e2ce570ede4582c875c0550d5ba8da60d9

commit_message:
Remove bundled intree freezer tempest plugin

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526664/ moves the intree tempest
  plugin to freezer-tempest-plugin repo.

* Excluding freezer/tests/freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_version.py as
  it is dependent on freezer project and moving under integration tests.

Depends-On: I6967f915758728827e8ddcd1a45a7023904b694e
Change-Id: I4625d55a768f1ad0762fc2d8554998825f0d6716

commit_message:
Merge intree freezer-api tempest plugin into freezer tempest plugin

* It merges the freezer-api tempest plugin into freezer tempest
  plugin by moving freezer and freezer-api tempest tests in
  freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/freezer and
  freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/freezer_api.

* clients.py is moved under main root folder.

Change-Id: I66cc2507b0bbd9dda9d6279f9b8d74c546d1b0a6

commit_message:
Zero sizes qoutas caused incorrect size matching

* this adds a few extras cases for quota size matching
  to avoid/handle zero quotas as they are a valid use case.

Change-Id: I1d7b63b79b60c4c37a3a356e5410b44e0f9b078c
Closes-Bug: 1737118

makes it a bit hard to navigate around the code, this patch removes it

commit_message:
Topology: dispatch ovs port events directly

This changes discards dynamic handler retrieval in favor of direct
method calls. Old code was doing something along the lines of:

 handler = getattr(self, '_{port_type}_{action}')
 if handler:
     # ....

Since there aren't that much cases to cover, and the dynamic resolution
makes it a bit hard to navigate around the code, this patch removes it
in favor of direct approach.

Closes-Bug: #1737339
Change-Id: Icbe50c0c74bcfaa89903e18808c3beca616638f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 17:03:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix NoneType error when [service_user] is misconfigured

If the [service_user]/send_service_user_token option is
set to True but the actual auth options are incomplete,
like missing to set the auth_type option, we eventually
fail to re-auth with keystone due to a NoneType error
in keystoneauth1.

We can detect this issue because load_auth_from_conf_options
will return None and we can just log a warning and continue
as if the service user was never configured in the first place.

Change-Id: I0a96c835d620307f1ab34736ba42c2deb1321a23
Closes-Bug: #1733642

commit_message:
Fix NoneType error when [service_user] is misconfigured

If the [service_user]/send_service_user_token option is
set to True but the actual auth options are incomplete,
like missing to set the auth_type option, we eventually
fail to re-auth with keystone due to a NoneType error
in keystoneauth1.

We can detect this issue because load_auth_from_conf_options
will return None and we can just log a warning and continue
as if the service user was never configured in the first place.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I0a96c835d620307f1ab34736ba42c2deb1321a23
Closes-Bug: #1733642

commit_message:
Retiring App Catalog

This commit removes legacy review jobs
associated with the app catalog. This is
part of the first step, following the
guide at:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Earlier this year the TC agreed to retire this project:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452086/

In July, Fungi sent
a note to the operators list as well:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2017-July/013965.html

Depends-On: I52ce13057643d69a0fd87bce20ee460c6b7c2f17

Change-Id: I8df56c5ef22392ee818a417a0d3eff40463c3f47

commit_message:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2017-July/013965.html

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Id9b20c3ddb141f5237b2a072d89b3ec0786a1dbd

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 18:58:22.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ie12cf1e6eef1a59fb017721d4c475f8cf368c667
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ie12cf1e6eef1a59fb017721d4c475f8cf368c667

commit_message:
Fix bug with deps

If deps weren't in the right order, it would sometimes mark them
wrong. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Idcc6d3997e128b6df28e42b28de73b152f1bf628

commit_message:
WIP - Pythonserver cleanup #1

Add SCSS and pull in a lot of dependencies directly into the server
via XStatic rather then link externally. Update testicons.html to
use it to create a testing ground to sharing code between the python
server and the horizon plugin.

This WIP pulls in parts of Horizon. Ideally those would be put in a
common library.

Change-Id: I80324c9c58c255d6afd1c489172c703d9c9666f1

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.6

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I669a9f252292459bcb1ed92291e28d8d107e7203
Change-Id: Ic1bad72eae69fe26ffad595c7e62aa7281d556e2

commit_message:
Update variable scopes

Trove depends on those definitions, and we should probably
use those same definitions inside haproxy configuration.

We should therefore move them to all, else the translation build
would fail.

Change-Id: I20d1335c32d204fc41c5f5920c89a3d7e283cd56

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-10 08:41:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix prep-zanata client unarchive

When the cached_client file exists on the target, we need to use
"remote_src: yes" in order to use it and not try to copy from the
local machine.

Change-Id: I254eafbdd6715d818e0bd5c6fd0cc2c14a736c9c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prep-zanata client unarchive

When the cached_client file exists on the target, we need to use
"remote_src: yes" in order to use it and not try to copy from the
local machine.

Change-Id: I254eafbdd6715d818e0bd5c6fd0cc2c14a736c9c

commit_message:
Fix unittests

The patch [0] integrating floating ips with OVO in neutron changed some
of the internals about how the data in the fip object is manipulated.
This patch extends the FakeResource class to adhere to the new changes.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396351/

Change-Id: I201b90919da829e0a4641447e682a6a408eb6231

commit_message:
Topology: remove local cache of OVS ports

A previous patch moves all OvsPort filtering to vswitch_impl. This makes
all updates valid for topology. This patch removes the local cache in
favor of using DbStore.

Partial-Bug: #1737339
Change-Id: I686ec4dc99eda643db85b2a4f706250e58155e89

commit_message:
Topology: move filtering to ovsdb monitor

Topology app keeps a local ovs port cache because it does not want all
port updates to take effect. In particular, events with missing data
(ofport, type). Moving this logic to vswitch_impl because it makes a lot
of sense to hold off those events even for apps that consume OvsPorts.

Partial-Bug: #1737339
Change-Id: I0bc8053d6fb3ed277028cf6bce9c6a0269e601af

commit_message:
Run ARA only if enabled

Adds a switch to disable the ARA static site generation in the exit
tasks if the environment has disabled it.

Change-Id: I814f7bd77d13e049c0a24745f49f4c5ef5999bc4
(cherry picked from commit d03f39c06d68927ed538fe1660075d6ff87d54e2)

commit_message:
adjust zuul_work_dir determination for cross-jobs

zuul.projects was changed from a list to a dict recently,
so we need to adjust to a different way of finding
the zuul_work_dir

Change-Id: If2c3042ce5bc10a9d02decef34abdad65a53f5f8

commit_message:
Disable offloading in test by default

We disable offloading in test for ubuntu this change does the same for
suse and cent. This should help resolve the kernel crashes and traces
we're seeing in the gate.

Change-Id: I6001a3b107c5679d8758aa35dc29a6fe6054e088
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit c2402a0723eff832a78fb82a966a608fa45b150f)

Fix ansible assert

Fix syntax, this needs a "that" for ansible, also checksum is within the
stat hash.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-10 03:03:13.000000000', 'message': 'Enable access to the pypi-server on the repo infra

pypi-server is running on the repo-server this change allows the

port 8280.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Enable access to the pypi-server on the repo infra

pypi-server is running on the repo-server this change allows the
internal infrastructure access to the repo-server using http on
port 8280.

Change-Id: Ib38cb46a8cfbc26ac58c426f7637c8a08d703570
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.14

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I655eed25c8a77402611311c42f913cea385a6c86
Change-Id: Ic4da1bbbaff22bd4151bb008bbe84a953262234d

messages:
[{'account_id': 27319, 'date': '2017-11-19 12:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-19 12:23:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27319, 'date': '2017-11-19 12:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2017-11-19 14:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2017-11-19 12:22:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix Bug: concurrent deletion for volumes which host is None cause wrong quota deduction.

The volume's host maybe None in some situation, such as the wrong volume_backend_name configuration or the capacity of the volume backend.
When delete such a volume in a very short time twice, the two deletion request will both successful, and the gigabytes quota will be deduction twice, this will quite vulnerable.

Change-Id: Ib681609287cced9cf108abd8599e4b557347d236
Closes-Bug: #1733179
"}, {'created': '2017-11-19 12:37:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix wrong quota deduction when concurrent deletion for
volumes which host is None.

Put the deletion logic of None host volumes after the
condictional_update, let the volume's status change be
 the locker of the concurrent deletion for None host
volumes, and avoid the quota to be decress many times.

commit_message:
[WIP]Fix wrong quota deduction when concurrent deletion for
volumes which host is None.

Put the deletion logic of None host volumes after the
condictional_update, let the volume's status change be
 the locker of the concurrent deletion for None host
volumes, and avoid the quota to be decress many times.

Change-Id: Ib681609287cced9cf108abd8599e4b557347d236
Closes-Bug: #1733179

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 16:16:20.000000000', 'message': 'horizon: Move test files to match corresponding module structure

blueprint relocation-test-codes

The current test file structure in horizon looks random.
This is the first patch of blueprint relocation-test-codes.

This commit proposes to change the structure to match the structure
of test targets (i.e., main codes).
More concretely, a unit test file for {TOP_MODULE}/{MODULE}/{FILENAME}.py
will be located at {TOP_MODULE}/test/units/{MODULE}/test_{FILENAME}.py.
When a module is test as a whole, a location of a corresponding test file
will be {TOP_MODULE}/test/units/{MODULE}/test_{MODULE}.py.
This clarifies locations of test files.

In addition, this commit changes the base class of utils.test_secret_key
from horizon.test.helper.TestCase to unittest.TestCase. This is because
calling secret_key.generate_key() somehow interferes django.test.TestCase
(which is a parent class of horizon.test.helper.TestCase).

Change-Id: I48b9c317645e63a5819c52512b30f25969574817

commit_message:
horizon: Move test files to match corresponding module structure

blueprint relocation-test-codes

The current test file structure in horizon looks random.
This is the first patch of blueprint relocation-test-codes.

This commit proposes to change the structure to match the structure
of test targets (i.e., main codes).
More concretely, a unit test file for {TOP_MODULE}/{MODULE}/{FILENAME}.py
will be located at {TOP_MODULE}/test/units/{MODULE}/test_{FILENAME}.py.
When a module is test as a whole, a location of a corresponding test file
will be {TOP_MODULE}/test/units/{MODULE}/test_{MODULE}.py.
This clarifies locations of test files.

In addition, this commit changes the base class of utils.test_secret_key
from horizon.test.helper.TestCase to unittest.TestCase. This is because
calling secret_key.generate_key() somehow interferes django.test.TestCase
(which is a parent class of horizon.test.helper.TestCase).

Change-Id: I48b9c317645e63a5819c52512b30f25969574817

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.2.14

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I838555a799caf6fec70eb680555a1ae2dc66b384
Change-Id: I726a69b529a6447c20b71f1c0a3d11d3e5b29f3a

commit_message:
Fix ansible lint tests

On top of that, it bumps the version of bindep.txt
from the osa-tests repo, because the automatic bump
cannot merge without lint tests passing, and the
other way around. Moreover, we drop the 'force'
argument from zypper since we are not switching
package vendors anymore.

[hwoarang: Add patch from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526128/
to unblock the gates]

Depends-On: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138
Change-Id: I67e44434d4b3eb07b8af5c12aaa807514518be4c

commit_message:
Simplify usage of docker container

* Move default config to /etc/rally, so it will be possible top mount
  custom directories to /home/rally

* Update help message

* Add gitter info

* Use proper versions of python dependencies (upper-constaints file)

Change-Id: If33ae8e6441bbea35f31b232adb229fc193fbd0d

commit_message:
Exclude dev-deploy job from doc-only change

This patch set updates the zuul job to not execute a full
dev-deploy job when the change only impacts documentation,
so it is inline with other jobs that runs the full deployment.

Change-Id: Ica18b5bf903765acde91e686bf6d4453fd366d06

commit_message:
Fix failure while installing devstack by vagrant.

Changed box for the different hypervisors to ubuntu 16.04LTS (xenial).
Updated the etcd checksum, as we are using a different version.
Changed the VM creation to be serial, as the compute nodes must be
started after the controller node is already up.
Updated the script to take the correct configuration file as their
names were changed over time.
Changed configuration to use etcd entirely.

Co-Authored-By: Shachar Snapiri <shachar.snapiri@huawei.com>
Change-Id: I0c1df8117393c5c65ce93c00604bca1ee7b38d20
Closes-bug: #1655939

commit_message:
Rename the json printer to jsonschema

As per dimak's request on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523848/ the
json printer was renamed to jsonschema.
Also, for ease of use added short-name arguments as well.

Change-Id: I056bd459f22c2d1500f4d2539139f2f25a1e433e
Partial-Bug: #1734146

commit_message:
Fix SDK Connection creation alternative to Profile

Do a dummy import to determine which SDK is installed (Pre/post merge).

This solves the DevStack error "Cloud defaults was not found" in -tips jobs.

Depends-On: Ia111f127fbdceac2afe20fd9d1fe032145cdd72c
Change-Id: I60c2d418dd5a393eee2cc2a5c2fdebfffdabf2d3

messages:
[{'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-12-09 11:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-09 15:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Unfortunately the 0b2 tag is already there, and we don't have a way to move it to another commit. The release team will need to talk about whether we should have you use 0b3 or just forego the q2 milestone (detecting issues like this is one of the reasons we do milestones, after all)."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-09 17:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We may want to just leave this as is and pick up with queens-3. Unless we know of someone that needs the b2 artifacts for testing and packaging. I would guess it would not be a big deal to skip though.

At least it is tagged so if anyone wants to, they can get the milestone source.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-12-09 19:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Got it. Thanks Doug and Sean!'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-12-09 19:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-29 10:28:09.000000000', 'message': 'Flexible horizon dashboard configuration

If any user wants to provide its own dashboard, he can now
install its own pip package by overriding the proper variables,
and then do the linking directly by overriding the new variable,
``horizon_panels``.

If we wants to use any existing horizon_panels, and just add a
personal panel, a deployer must define the override like this:
``horizon_panels: "{{ my_horizon_panels + _horizon_panels }}"``
where ``my_horizon_panels`` is a list whose items are composed
of src, dest, and state.

commit_message:
Flexible horizon dashboard configuration

If any user wants to provide its own dashboard, he can now
install its own pip package by overriding the proper variables,
and then do the linking directly by overriding the new variable,
``horizon_panels``.

If we wants to use any existing horizon_panels, and just add a
personal panel, a deployer must define the override like this:
``horizon_panels: "{{ my_horizon_panels + _horizon_panels }}"``
where ``my_horizon_panels`` is a list whose items are composed
of src, dest, and state.

Change-Id: I87324aaa3a685b1e65081b7c7dce767c080f22ee

commit_message:
Override galera_monitoring_allowed_source

By default, the galera_monitoring_allowed_source is secured in the
galera_role to have no external access.

We haproxy and galera nodes need to access the mysql check xinetd tool,
so we override it here.

Change-Id: Ib6f67e002fcd288caf278adfe717b3ccb4440ce5

commit_message:
Unmap compute nodes when deleting host mapping

When we delete a host mapping in the api database, we need to mark
the compute node record as unmapped. Otherwise we can never re-discover
it if added back.

Change-Id: I9348827c5fd0364727e49cb8fae786cb2a29472a
Closes-Bug: #1735719

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 14:38:17.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore syslog settings if /dev/log is not present

When journald crashes, the /dev/log socket is not present
and rootwrap calls fail with an unclear error message.

Ignore syslog configuration, log a warning and proceed in
those cases.

Change-Id: I4152593696ad63a977f127da3b00934feb14b069
Closes-Bug: #1730949
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore syslog settings if /dev/log is not present

When journald crashes, the /dev/log socket is not present
and rootwrap calls fail with an unclear error message.

Ignore syslog configuration, log a warning and proceed in
those cases.

Change-Id: I4152593696ad63a977f127da3b00934feb14b069
Closes-Bug: #1730949

commit_message:
Remove method get_connect_string and is_backend_avail

method get_connect_string  is deprecated and will be removed
from oslo_db in a few releases.Please use the provisioning
system for dealing with URLs and database provisioning.

method is_backend_avail  is deprecated and will be removed
from oslo_db in a few releases.Please use the provisioning
system to access databases based on backend availability.

Change-Id: Idc27d45e96aad7b28b4332b0d8ab8c10bca73e67

commit_message:
Follow up on removing old-style quotas code

This is a follow up to another patch [1] that removed the old-style
quotas code which is no longer in use. Here, we remove the 'reserved'
key from quotas internally and set it in the APIs where it's expected.
We also remove code that accesses the quota_usages and reservations
tables as they're no longer used.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511689

Change-Id: I75291571468ddb79b7561810de0953bb462548e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 14:50:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix HA router initialization exception

When an HA router initialization fails early, it can lead to:

 AttributeError: 'HaRouter' object has no attribute 'process_monitor'

Add init of 'self.process_monitor' in RouterInfo init code in
case we try and cleanup early.

Change-Id: Iddeaeef13adee10f7b130e3f9e584b6e9f037030
Closes-bug: #1735557
(cherry picked from commit c62d54d0c21fc4a760d2ac6501f9493137c5eb8a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix HA router initialization exception

When an HA router initialization fails early, it can lead to:

 AttributeError: 'HaRouter' object has no attribute 'process_monitor'

Add init of 'self.process_monitor' in RouterInfo init code in
case we try and cleanup early.

Change-Id: Iddeaeef13adee10f7b130e3f9e584b6e9f037030
Closes-bug: #1735557
(cherry picked from commit c62d54d0c21fc4a760d2ac6501f9493137c5eb8a)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: Ic330a46e97a2bbbfebf493272eb5ffe59595ddd5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 07:41:33.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fix error when using protocol number in sg

The solution introduced in [1] has two deficiencies:

- It is missing a couple of protocols
- '1' != 1

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
"}, {'created': '2017-11-29 00:53:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in SG

The solution introduced in [1] has two deficiencies:

- It is missing a couple of protocols
- '1' != 1

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number,
like 'tcp' and not '6'.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the SG code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
"}, {'created': '2017-11-29 04:03:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in SG

The solution introduced in [1] has two deficiencies:

- It is missing a couple of protocols
- '1' != 1

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number,
like 'tcp' and not '6'.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the SG code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
"}, {'created': '2017-11-30 22:42:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in SG

The solution introduced in [1] has two deficiencies:

- It is missing a couple of protocols
- '1' != 1

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number,
like 'tcp' and not '6'.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the SG code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
"}, {'created': '2017-12-01 21:43:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in SG

The solution introduced in [1] has two deficiencies:

- It is missing a couple of protocols
- '1' != 1

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number,
like 'tcp' and not '6'.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the SG code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
"}, {'created': '2017-12-07 01:44:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in SG

When the support of protocol numbers was fixed in [1]
it introduced two deficiencies in the iptables code:

- it was missing a couple of protocols, for example, 'icmp',
  'tcp' and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we
  did not use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the SG code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

"}, {'created': '2017-12-07 04:27:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in security groups

When the support of protocol numbers in security groups
was fixed in [1], it introduced two deficiencies in the
iptables code:

- it was missing some protocols, for example, 'icmp', 'tcp'
  and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we did not
  use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the security group code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711

commit_message:
Fix error when using protocol number in security groups

When the support of protocol numbers in security groups
was fixed in [1], it introduced two deficiencies in the
iptables code:

- it was missing some protocols, for example, 'icmp', 'tcp'
  and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we did not
  use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the security group code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711

commit_message:
Run the swift object expirer in the undercloud

This includes the expirer module to enable the service, otherwise swift
objects are never cleaned up in the undercloud.

Change-Id: I65b906aaa7ea4f79e2c041009cf7055d2d1fe403
Closes-Bug: #1722279

The openstack_hosts role now calls the pip_install role, so
we need to ensure the urls are properly set up before running the
role.

Using the common tasks checks if the repo is created, and uses

Change-Id: If19442918baa9ddacf7c19940c9b5007694bee61
'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 15:23:38.000000000', 'message': 'Set the default pip index dynamically

Before the repo server is up, only bare metal hosts
need pip installed, openstack-hosts-setup take care
of that part by default, with the openstack_host role
calling pip_install.

Once the repo server is up, the pypi cache will be available
to be used. This implements the changes to detect whether it
is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

To be available, we need to wait for haproxy playbook to
load balance towards the repo container, or the baremetal
node if need be.

Once the repo server and the load balancer are up, we
can configure everything to use the repo server, and this
will be done with the repo-use.yml playbook, which is
calling the pip_install role.

We also remove the use of the pip_lock_to_internal_repo
from group variables, as we want to change the pip.conf
dynamically dependeing on the availability of the default
index, instead of setting no-index and only relying on
links.

Finally, we set the AIO in OpenStack-Infra to make use of
the appropriate infra mirror for the nginx reverse proxy.

Change-Id: If19442918baa9ddacf7c19940c9b5007694bee61
Depends-On: I56f22f46ff849a7049ac7ae873af7a4bc526fa63
Depends-On: Ic4fd64f4dc82121a65088f3d7f4ae53f373df608
Depends-On: I7bd31f2d89d3fe9d48e32c79ddef7a8ef1392eb7
Depends-On: Icd93c0c801bfee1b4fdc8154d078067722c0640a
Depends-On: I1e9782eb0fd72690a9644c7a01e8c83a4486872b
Co-Authored-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 18:58:20.000000000', 'message': 'Set the default pip index dynamically

Before the repo server is up, only bare metal hosts
need pip installed, openstack-hosts-setup take care
of that part by default, with the openstack_host role
calling pip_install.

Once the repo server is up, the pypi cache will be available
to be used. This implements the changes to detect whether it
is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

To be available, we need to wait for haproxy playbook to
load balance towards the repo container, or the baremetal
node if need be.

Once the repo server and the load balancer are up, we
can configure everything to use the repo server, and this
will be done with the repo-use.yml playbook, which is
calling the pip_install role.

We also remove the use of the pip_lock_to_internal_repo
from group variables, as we want to change the pip.conf
dynamically dependeing on the availability of the default
index, instead of setting no-index and only relying on
links.

Finally, we set the AIO in OpenStack-Infra to make use of
the appropriate infra mirror for the nginx reverse proxy.

Once the repo server is up, the pypi cache will be available

is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

To be available, we need to wait for haproxy playbook to
load balance towards the repo container, or the baremetal
node if need be.

Once the repo server and the load balancer are up, we
can configure everything to use the repo server, and this
will be done with the repo-use.yml playbook, which is
calling the pip_install role.

We also remove the use of the pip_lock_to_internal_repo
from group variables, as we want to change the pip.conf
dynamically dependeing on the availability of the default
index, instead of setting no-index and only relying on
links.

Finally, we set the AIO in OpenStack-Infra to make use of
the appropriate infra mirror for the nginx reverse proxy.

Because the gates are blocked without this patch, this
patch should land in priority. The current upstream state
prevents that, so we temporarily disable the ceph testing,
which fails due to [1].

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1737015

commit_message:
Set the default pip index dynamically

Before the repo server is up, only bare metal hosts
need pip installed, openstack-hosts-setup take care
of that part by default, with the openstack_host role
calling pip_install.

Once the repo server is up, the pypi cache will be available
to be used. This implements the changes to detect whether it
is available - this is important for the plays doing pip
installs before the repo server is available. Once it is
available the same plays will use it.

To be available, we need to wait for haproxy playbook to
load balance towards the repo container, or the baremetal
node if need be.

Once the repo server and the load balancer are up, we
can configure everything to use the repo server, and this
will be done with the repo-use.yml playbook, which is
calling the pip_install role.

We also remove the use of the pip_lock_to_internal_repo
from group variables, as we want to change the pip.conf
dynamically depending on the availability of the default
index.

Finally, we set the AIO in OpenStack-Infra to make use of
the appropriate infra mirror for the nginx reverse proxy.

Because the gates are blocked without this patch, this
patch should land in priority. The current upstream state
prevents that, so we temporarily disable the ceph testing,
which fails due to [1]. On top of it, we need to bump
shas to a known working state, else tempest would fail.
To avoid circular dependencies, we include the content
of patch [2], which is the sha bump pending this work.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1737015
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522850/

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 10:00:12.000000000', 'message': "tempest: check router interface exists before ssh

As explained in the bug, tempest DVR and HA migration scenario
tests are failing intermittently, as we are not checking if the
new router interfaces are ready after migration and might try
to use the old dataplane if the pre-migration router resources
(like interfaces, namespaces, etc) still exist and are not yet
destroyed.

We need to check that the pre-migration router interfaces are
deleted and the new interfaces are created and active (as we
can't check namespace existence on other nodes, we rely on port
status set by L2 agent after wiring the port) before
attempting ssh connectivity.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py

Closes-Bug: 1714802
Change-Id: I2a933d4cdd6de4e5ff31c8e3f97477819ba27afa
(cherry picked from commit f5718972257cf229c8a9db0a5fc4349acbaade12)
"}]
commit_message:
tempest: check router interface exists before ssh

As explained in the bug, tempest DVR and HA migration scenario
tests are failing intermittently, as we are not checking if the
new router interfaces are ready after migration and might try
to use the old dataplane if the pre-migration router resources
(like interfaces, namespaces, etc) still exist and are not yet
destroyed.

We need to check that the pre-migration router interfaces are
deleted and the new interfaces are created and active (as we
can't check namespace existence on other nodes, we rely on port
status set by L2 agent after wiring the port) before
attempting ssh connectivity.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py

Closes-Bug: 1714802
Change-Id: I2a933d4cdd6de4e5ff31c8e3f97477819ba27afa
(cherry picked from commit f5718972257cf229c8a9db0a5fc4349acbaade12)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I960a7906e78b804cbda60ccf5a8a932a0af66aea

commit_message:
[placement] Fix an error message in API validation

Fix the error message in validation of the following API
when the name exceeds max character length(255).

* PUT /traits/{name}

Change-Id: I2bbbadd7842bf4652d3c32ae3e5c74e2e159990b
Closes-Bug: #1735343

commit_message:
Add API and nova-manage tests that use the NoopQuotaDriver

These are written in preparation for follow up old-style quotas code
removal that moves the logic for the 'reserved' field from the quota
internals (where it's no longer used) to the API (where it's expected
to be provided until we have a new microversion). These tests will
help catch any unintended change in behavior.

Change-Id: I1f743a8db7d032e09372587622ab64250a05e0f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 06:11:17.000000000', 'message': '[Qos] Fix residues of ovs in ingress bw limit

When we delete vm port with attached QoS policy,
it is just doing nothing if vif_port does not exist.

This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured
directly on vif_port in OVS.

For ingress bw limit however it uses additional records in
Openvswitch database: qos and queue. Those records are not
cleaned up in such case.

This patch also records port in self.ports in the case of
bandwidth limit rules, just as in the case of dscp rules.
Never execute port clear if vif_port not exists. Finally, ovs
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Iddeb49e1e6538a178ca468df0fdf9e0617ca4f1c
Closes-Bug: #1726732
'}, {'created': '2017-12-06 07:39:30.000000000', 'message': '[Qos] Fix residues of ovs in ingress bw limit

When we delete vm port with attached QoS policy,
it is just doing nothing if vif_port does not exist.

This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured
directly on vif_port in OVS.

For ingress bw limit however it uses additional records in
Openvswitch database: qos and queue. Those records are not
cleaned up in such case.

This patch also records port in self.ports in the case of
bandwidth limit rules, just as in the case of dscp rules.
Never execute port clear if vif_port not exists. Finally, ovs
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Iddeb49e1e6538a178ca468df0fdf9e0617ca4f1c
Closes-Bug: #1726732
(cherry picked from commit ee423e1fa035146904eb8cdd78660cf1cafa64e8)
'}]
commit_message:
[Qos] Fix residues of ovs in ingress bw limit

When we delete vm port with attached QoS policy,
it is just doing nothing if vif_port does not exist.

This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured
directly on vif_port in OVS.

For ingress bw limit however it uses additional records in
Openvswitch database: qos and queue. Those records are not
cleaned up in such case.

This patch also records port in self.ports in the case of
bandwidth limit rules, just as in the case of dscp rules.
Never execute port clear if vif_port not exists. Finally, ovs
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Iddeb49e1e6538a178ca468df0fdf9e0617ca4f1c
Closes-Bug: #1726732
(cherry picked from commit ee423e1fa035146904eb8cdd78660cf1cafa64e8)

Reformat _get_all_with_shared

This change set pulls the otherwise-unrelated reformatting out of [1].
There is no functional change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/377215/48/nova/objects/resource_provider.py@1275

commit_message:
Scheduler set_inventory_for_provider does nested

SchedulerReportClient.set_inventory_for_provider and its SchedulerClient
wrapper now accept a parent_provider_uuid kwarg, which must be specified
for any provider that isn't a root.  If the method winds up creating the
provider, and parent_provider_uuid is None (the default), the provider
is created as a root - this is the previous behavior.  If
parent_provider_uuid is specified, and the method winds up creating the
provider, it is created as a child of the provider indicated.

Change-Id: I7cfbc80a9a41e97623950deaab9a7b0604fa487d
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 19:16:34.000000000', 'message': '[placement] Object changes to support last-modified headers

A variety of changes are required to allow the various entities
presented by the placement API to have last-modified times.

According to the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This patch provides necessary changes to the database and object
handling that will support the API changes made in a followup patch.

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* Tweak queries to retrieve updated_at and created_at fields where
  they are not already present

Change-Id: I3f6310af9c5bea682e793d27d480952aa8776d61
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
'}, {'created': '2017-11-21 09:05:56.000000000', 'message': '[placement] Object changes to support last-modified headers

of resources.

This patch provides necessary changes to the database and object
handling that will support the API changes made in a followup patch.

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* Tweak queries to retrieve updated_at and created_at fields where
  they are not already present

Change-Id: I3f6310af9c5bea682e793d27d480952aa8776d61
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

'}, {'created': '2017-12-06 15:16:39.000000000', 'message': "[placement] Object changes to support last-modified headers

According to the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do

of resources.

This patch provides necessary changes to the database and object

* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* Tweak queries to retrieve updated_at and created_at fields where
  they are not already present

Note that only those objects which are directly represented in response
bodies and directly associated with a database resource that has
created_at and updated_at fields are changed (e.g., resource providers).

Other objects, like usage and allocaiton candidates, which are
composites and represent the state of the universe _now_, will use the
current time when they get last-modified headers in the next patch.

Some HTTP requests, such as GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates
are based on a association that happens at a time that is not recorded
and is ambiguous: should we tell last-modified time of the most recently
created aggregate uuid, or the time when the association between a
resource provider and an aggregate was made (which we don't know). In
those cases where a solution is unclear, no object or database changes
are made, and the next patch will use the current time in any related
last-modified headers.

commit_message:
[placement] Object changes to support last-modified headers

A variety of changes are required to allow the various entities
presented by the placement API to have last-modified times.

According to the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This patch provides necessary changes to the database and object
handling that will support the API changes made in a followup patch.

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* Tweak queries to retrieve updated_at and created_at fields where
  they are not already present

Note that only those objects which are directly represented in response
bodies and directly associated with a database resource that has
created_at and updated_at fields are changed (e.g., resource providers).

Other objects, like usage and allocaiton candidates, which are
composites and represent the state of the universe _now_, will use the
current time when they get last-modified headers in the next patch.

Some HTTP requests, such as GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates
are based on a association that happens at a time that is not recorded
and is ambiguous: should we tell last-modified time of the most recently
created aggregate uuid, or the time when the association between a
resource provider and an aggregate was made (which we don't know). In
those cases where a solution is unclear, no object or database changes
are made, and the next patch will use the current time in any related
last-modified headers.

Change-Id: I3f6310af9c5bea682e793d27d480952aa8776d61
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/385693/64/ : SUCCESS in 3h 27m 08s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-10-31 12:37:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 64:

So it turns out the failing python35 functional test is related to the fact that gabbi is case sensitive for request headers (because under the table they are just keys in a dict). In the test that's failing the microversion is overridden, but because it is a different case it actually means that two headers are sent.

On the application side, these are both taken and turned into values for the same header and the order is apparently being different between python 3.5 and 2.7. microversion parse only chooses one.

The fix is to make the file use the same case for openstack-api-version throughout, which I will do as a separate fix that we could perhaps merge before this one?

If that's too slow, get past this problem by lowercasing openstack-api-version"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-11-02 16:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 65: Patch Set 64 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-02 17:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-11-02 17:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 66: Patch Set 65 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-11-03 02:33:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 66:

As Eric has pointed out, there may be an issue happening where the newly available ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed is happening when the placement service is not yet ready to support version 1.14 (perhaps because it hasn't been restarted yet).

In the past this would have been a none and by the time the next job came round things would work. Now we log an error, which is potentially distracting.

If this continues happening there's probably some digging in grenade we should do to ensure that placement is fully upgrade before any compute is.

Changes seem sane, unless we think there should be some kind of safer handling on a 406 (what happens when the new microversion is not available)."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-04 23:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 84:

commit_message:
placement: update client to set parent provider

In preparation for future commits which will add child resource
providers for SR-IOV physical functions, this patch updates the
scheduler report client to use the new 1.12 microversion of the
placement API and set/get the 'parent_provider_uuid' attribute of the
resource provider created during calls to '_create_resource_provider()'

Change-Id: I2f367b06e683ed7c815dd9e0536a46e5f0a27e6c
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
Co-Authored-By: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Grenade fix for placement restart:
Depends-On: I7f2158aeaef82a47e11c6e29675e542023fff4be

@Kevin Benton,

I investigated the failure of neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.test_plugin.TestMultiSegmentNetworks.test_release_network_segments as a consequence of reverting 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd. We get an StaleDataError exception here https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py#L459 as a consequence of trying to delete the standard_attr records for the network segments that were deleted by _delete_segments_for_network callback.

Looking at the NetworkSegment table https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/models/segment.py#L53, I can see that it has cascae='delete' on its network orm relationship. I looked at the commit that added this callback (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317358) and I couldn't find any rationale for it. So I decided we don't need it.

Of course, I might be missing something. I also experimented with expiring network_db and reading it again in the delete_network method of the DB plugin. That also fixes the problem."}, {'account_id': 20330, 'date': '2017-07-26 22:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Microsoft Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-20 23:25:24.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT"

This reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of them, it is not possible to delete a routed network, because the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact that the associated subnets still exist.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1696537

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}, {'created': '2017-06-20 23:26:33.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT"

This reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of them, it is
not possible to delete a routed network, because the segments cannot be
deleted due to the fact that the associated subnets still exist.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1696537

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}, {'created': '2017-07-26 21:16:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove _delete_segments_for_network callback

This commit removes the _delete_segments_for_network callback that is
intended to delete segments when the network they belong to is deleted.
The NetworkSegments DB table has cascade='delete' in its network orm
relationship. As a consequence, segments are deleted by the DBMS when
its network is deleted.

This will also fix a couple of bugs that are a consequence of the fact
that _delete_segments_for_network is being executed in response to a
BEFORE_DELETE network event.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1696537

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
"}, {'created': '2017-07-27 19:46:26.000000000', 'message': "Remove _delete_segments_for_network callback

"}, {'created': '2017-07-27 20:37:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove _delete_segments_for_network callback

This commit removes the _delete_segments_for_network callback that is
intended to delete segments when the network they belong to is deleted.
The NetworkSegments DB table has cascade='delete' in its network orm
relationship. As a consequence, segments are deleted by the DBMS when
its network is deleted.

This will also fix a couple of bugs that are a consequence of the fact
that _delete_segments_for_network is being executed in response to a
BEFORE_DELETE network event.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1696537

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
"}, {'created': '2017-07-31 02:28:15.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT"

This reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to BEFORE_DELETE
network event has created some bugs. In one of them, it is not possible to
delete a routed network, because the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact
that the associated subnets still exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE introduces
StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the deleted segments. To work
around that, network_db is expired and read again after notifying the
PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

Closes-Bug #1697324

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}, {'created': '2017-07-31 02:31:46.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT"

This reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to BEFORE_DELETE
network event has created some bugs. In one of them, it is not possible to
delete a routed network, because the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact
that the associated subnets still exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE introduces
StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the deleted segments. To work
around that, network_db is expired and read again after notifying the
PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

Closes-Bug #1697324

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}, {'created': '2017-07-31 02:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT"

This reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to BEFORE_DELETE
network event has created some bugs. In one of them, it is not possible to
delete a routed network, because the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact
that the associated subnets still exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE introduces
StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the deleted segments. To work
around that, network_db is expired and read again after notifying the
PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

Closes-Bug #1697324

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}, {'created': '2017-12-06 04:00:46.000000000', 'message': 'Move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE

This essentially reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of them,
it is not possible to delete a routed network, because the segments
cannot be deleted due to the fact that the associated subnets still
exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

This also fixes an issue where we could delete the segment ID
of the l3-ha network when deleting a router, leaving all other
routers non-functioning.  Moving this to PRECOMMIT_DELETE fixes
it since it is done after we have checked that the network is
not in use and can be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1697324
Closes-Bug: #1732543

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}]
commit_message:
Move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE

This essentially reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of them,
it is not possible to delete a routed network, because the segments
cannot be deleted due to the fact that the associated subnets still
exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

This also fixes an issue where we could delete the segment ID
of the l3-ha network when deleting a router, leaving all other
routers non-functioning.  Moving this to PRECOMMIT_DELETE fixes
it since it is done after we have checked that the network is
not in use and can be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1697324
Closes-Bug: #1732543

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f

commit_message:
Fix default deploy where undercloud install scripts are not installed.

It seems this tag (undercloud-scripts) is not there in default option
and hence the undercloud-install.sh is not created on the undercloud.

Refer https://goo.gl/bbbw8j

Fixes LP Bug #1736859

Change-Id: I222ca7c3b6743fa3255bd9d2e99285cec18d43d3
