commit_message:
Remove reference of policy.json from setup.cfg

With an effort to move policy in code, review [1]
removed policy.json from congress repo but missed
to remove reference from setup.cfg.
This patch removes the reference from setup.cfg.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/503167/

Change-Id: I62b14ddc5ccf3f0362a11b0fc773ccd92c325b93

commit_message:
Add backup-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the backup-delete command.

The trove command backup-delete is now:
    openstack database backup delete

Change-Id: I869d8649cc83d8c889995a8133e6b91407d7f862
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Document error

If 'Description' field is omitted in manifest.yaml file, the following
exception will be raised.

murano package-import ./HelloWorld/hello_world.zip
Failed to create package for './HelloWorld/hello_world.zip',
reason: Invalid Murano package E020 Missing required key
"Description" (HTTP 400)

Change-Id: I9096bf1a3dc56e2d9e5c335f4bfefddf0fd60108

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 20:40:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix cellsv1 messaging test

This test was completely not doing the thing it claimed to, because it
was calling the fake_save() method with keyword args that it wasn't
expecting. If you make the test fail for another reason, you see it in the
debug output, but not if it passes. Since the messenger swallows the
exception, we never notice that we did the wrong thing.

Change-Id: Id001f849709656c0ab30e8a8e8b8b3cc1d95d1d2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cellsv1 messaging test

This test was completely not doing the thing it claimed to, because it
was calling the fake_save() method with keyword args that it wasn't
expecting. If you make the test fail for another reason, you see it in the
debug output, but not if it passes. Since the messenger swallows the
exception, we never notice that we did the wrong thing.

Change-Id: Id001f849709656c0ab30e8a8e8b8b3cc1d95d1d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 17:45:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix TypeError of _get_project_id when project_id is None

If we get flavors with a domain token or an unscope token,
the project id of this case is None, will raise "TypeError:
'in <string>' requires string as left operand, not NoneType"
in _get_project_id. So, first we need check whether project_id
is None or not.

We can just return '' if project_id is None.

Change-Id: I8477d08a956a5b0262bd473254d9202738b6b65b
Closes-Bug: #1733746
(cherry picked from commit 036a692565ef0f1c730f28ea083465fad9dc3b13)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError of _get_project_id when project_id is None

If we get flavors with a domain token or an unscope token,
the project id of this case is None, will raise "TypeError:
'in <string>' requires string as left operand, not NoneType"
in _get_project_id. So, first we need check whether project_id
is None or not.

We can just return '' if project_id is None.

Change-Id: I8477d08a956a5b0262bd473254d9202738b6b65b
Closes-Bug: #1733746
(cherry picked from commit 036a692565ef0f1c730f28ea083465fad9dc3b13)

commit_message:
Remove murano-tempest-plugin entry from setup.cfg

As murano-tempest-plugin already been moved to separate
repo, it has to be removed from murano setup.cfg.

Due to this it will force murano installer to install murano-tempest-plugin
as Temepst will discover this plugin and complain about its missing package.

Congress is getting this error and their gate is blocked due to this.
http://logs.openstack.org/57/508657/22/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/1ad845d/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-07_19_33_07_219034

Change-Id: Iab3a851fdb9001ad39ef443be12701e0e2a75e5a
Closes-Bug: #1737123

I'm OK to change this, but would like other QA core's opinion."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2017-12-08 22:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

@Felipe - yea, there is no official guidelines for that and i do not think we should make one as that does not give any benefit. 

I am ok to follow what other plugin doing.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2017-12-09 02:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
scenario002-container: ignore telemetry & barbican tests

We made Telemetry tests working in Queens cycle, not before, so we don't
want to execute the tests in stable branches.

Co-Authored-By: Wesley Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1736475
Change-Id: I13e05e9d9462554465aeced856860a45e1740f27

commit_message:
Drop docker_name_space option

This setting doesn't exist in instack-undercloud and it has
long since been removed from t-h-t as well. There is no longer
any use for it.

Change-Id: I4aec82225c056e8cc7bf96a53bc9ce95957f9a2c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 13:58:34.000000000', 'message': 'Do not assume default values for undercloud.conf

Stop making assumption about the default values from undercloud.conf.
These can change and break quickstart. This also means the generated
undercloud.conf has broken documentation the day a default value
changes, making it harder to debug failures.

Be more specific and set defaults values for boolean variables.

Change-Id: I9c530e2234e627e9795347d2e5208e8dc965bb45
'}]
commit_message:
Do not assume default values for undercloud.conf

Stop making assumption about the default values from undercloud.conf.
These can change and break quickstart. This also means the generated
undercloud.conf has broken documentation the day a default value
changes, making it harder to debug failures.

Be more specific and set defaults values for boolean variables.

Change-Id: I9c530e2234e627e9795347d2e5208e8dc965bb45

commit_message:
Install openstack-heat-agents instead of python-heat-agent*

Use the openstack-heat-agents package to install all of the
python-heat-agent packages in the image, instead of having to specify
each individually.

Change-Id: I72caf6ff0dfa3f164737b92e89c1cc6043845864
Closes-Bug: #1737163

commit_message:
HAProxy logging

This patch is to increase the logging for haproxy. Currently HAProxy
doesn't log any events. This patch is to enable http logging when the
mode is http, also enable tcp logging when the mode is tcp.

Closes-Bug: #1713482

Change-Id: Idddb8844d03058d708b65b77efa04ca6571289a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-06 15:28:31.000000000', 'message': "Change RPC for select_destinations()

This changes the RPC call for select_destinations(). It adds a parameter
that I've named `modern_flag` because I can't think of a good name for
it, and didn't want to bikeshed on this. When a better name is agreed
to, I'll do a search/replace on it.

When this flag is True, the scheduler will return lists of lists of
Selection objects, representing the selected host and zero or more
alternates for each requested instance. When the flag is False, the
scheduler continues to return a list of host state dicts as before to
maintain backwards compatibility for older conductors.

Many of the tests have been cleaned up to work with these changes, but
there are still many to be fixed. But I wanted to get this posted for
feedback on the overall direction.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: I03b95a2106624c2ea24835814ca38e954ec7a997

commit_message:
Modify select_destinations() to return objects and alts

This changes select_destinations() on the scheduler side to optionally
return Selection objects and alternates. The RPC signature doesn't
change in this patch, though, so everything on the conductor side
remains unchanged. The next patch in the series will make the actual RPC
change.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: I03b95a2106624c2ea24835814ca38e954ec7a997

subject: Move the to_dict() method to the Selection object

commit_message:
Move the to_dict() method to the Selection object

With the RPC change coming in later patches in the series, it simply
makes more sense to have the method for converting a Selection object to
the older host_state dict format in the object itself.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: I2299c71e034299d63c267bc4cbe6360858445779

(2 comments)

I'm sure at some point in the last few months we've had a discussion about what the simplest (to read and reason about) return value from select_destinations() should be. :) Reading through this particular patch, I'm struck that instead of a two-tuple, both elements of the tuple having lists of lists, would it not be clearer to have the return value from select_destinations() instead be a single list of namedtuple elements, where the namedtuple would have a chosen_host, alternate_hosts, and allocation_requests attribute?

Something like this might work?

InstanceDestinationResult = collections.namedtuple('InstanceDestinationResult', ['chosen_destination', 'alternate_destinations', 'allocation_requests'])

And then we could return a list(InstanceDestinationResult) from select_destinations()?

Thoughts?

-jay"}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2017-08-28 13:14:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Jay - While I'm not sure what the best choice for a return value should be, I am sure that it isn't what we have here. That's why I wrote the blog post expressing my concerns. It is important that we take the time to design this properly, because we will be dealing with this for a long, long time."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2017-09-26 14:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has been replaced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486215/'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2017-09-26 20:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-21 13:36:19.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Add allocations to the values returned from the scheduler

This just adds the allocations to the value returned by the scheduler's
select_destinations(). It doesn't actually change the returned value;
that will be done in a later patch in the series.

Blueprint: placement-claims

Change-Id: I9f864455c69e1355a3cf06d7ba8b98fa3bcf619c
"}, {'created': '2017-08-23 20:40:38.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Add allocations to the values returned from the scheduler

This just adds the allocations to the value returned by the scheduler's
select_destinations(). It doesn't actually change the returned value;
that will be done in the next patch in the series.

Blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

Change-Id: I9f864455c69e1355a3cf06d7ba8b98fa3bcf619c
"}, {'created': '2017-08-24 21:07:29.000000000', 'message': "Add allocations to the values returned from the scheduler

This just adds the allocations to the value returned by the scheduler
drivers's select_destinations(). It doesn't actually change the returned
value from the scheduler to the conductor; that will be done in the next
patch in the series.

Blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

Change-Id: I9f864455c69e1355a3cf06d7ba8b98fa3bcf619c
"}, {'created': '2017-09-26 20:12:35.000000000', 'message': "Return Selection objects from the scheduler driver

This changes the returned value from the scheduler driver's
select_destinations() to a list of lists of Selection objects. It
doesn't actually change the returned value from the scheduler manager to
the conductor; that will be done in the next patch in the series, as
that will require an RPC change.

Blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

Change-Id: I9f864455c69e1355a3cf06d7ba8b98fa3bcf619c
"}, {'created': '2017-10-04 19:24:28.000000000', 'message': "Return Selection objects from the scheduler driver

This changes the returned value from the scheduler driver's
select_destinations() to a list of lists of Selection objects. It
doesn't actually change the returned value from the scheduler manager to
the conductor; that will be done in the next patch in the series, as
that will require an RPC change.

Blueprint: return-selection-objects

commit_message:
Return Selection objects from the scheduler driver

This changes the returned value from the scheduler driver's
select_destinations() to a list of lists of Selection objects. It
doesn't actually change the returned value from the scheduler manager to
the conductor; that will be done in the next patch in the series, as
that will require an RPC change.

During review it was noticed that the signature for the abstract
scheduler driver class was not updated when 'alloc_reqs_by_rp_uuid'
parameter was added back in e041fddeb027f909547ec46cb198262d410f7df7, so
I've updated it here to make all driver signatures the same.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: I9f864455c69e1355a3cf06d7ba8b98fa3bcf619c

commit_message:
Refactor the code to check for sufficient hosts

There are multiple places in the filter_scheduler code where we need to
check that we found enough hosts to match the request. This patch
refactors the code to create a single method that checks for that, and
raises a NoValidHost exception if there are not enough hosts.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: I858e7f19950c12421331cc2fbb033cd83fb0e260

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 20:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix doubling allocations on rebuild

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on). This fixes the subsequent doubling
of allocations that will occur by skipping the claim process if
a policy-only scheduler check is being performed.

Change-Id: I8a9157bc76ba1068ab966c4abdbb147c500604a8
(cherry picked from commit 8658e21a83db059675babbc9f7ed0cd36cfdff90)

commit_message:
Fix doubling allocations on rebuild

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on). This fixes the subsequent doubling
of allocations that will occur by skipping the claim process if
a policy-only scheduler check is being performed.

Closes-Bug: #1732976

Related-CVE: CVE-2017-17051
Related-OSSA: OSSA-2017-006

NOTE(mriedem): This change removes the Pike-only workaround
added in 234ade29a39cf2d51e08157e149e0cbd0c5047be.

Change-Id: I8a9157bc76ba1068ab966c4abdbb147c500604a8
(cherry picked from commit 25a1d78e83065c5bea5d8e0a017fd9d0914d41d9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-19 10:23:26.000000000', 'message': "[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-12-07 21:53:27.000000000', 'message': "[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

commit_message:
[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Cherry-pick notes: Had to make the ironic-grenade job non-voting so we
can get this to merge. Next patch will remove the ironic-grenade job.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6df49741ddf8fd28f78cebca4dca55d34a07a5a1)

commit_message:
Update jobs for tripleo-upgrades

tripleo-upgrades is a project with ansible roles, we want to run
openstack-tox-linters so we ensure a good ansible code quality.

Change-Id: I2b8ba3d2785ade99943adfc2ed31155679321bb0

commit_message:
xenapi: pass migrate_data to recover_method if live migrate fails

If live migration fails, the xenapi driver should pass the
migrate_data object to the recover_method (which is actually
ComputeManager._rollback_live_migration) so it can be used if
necessary.

Change-Id: Id123b1eb3f41a33657012ceeb2169f1b4e0e27bf

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3

Migrate all functional jobs and gate to zuul v3.
We will have to migrate all other legacy jobs too later.
This patch do step 1 in the docs: Move Legacy Jobs to Projects.

Co-Authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Make the get_service_type() overrides tolernat of no defaults

The service type overrides in get_service_type() fail if the
API version keys are not present in the config dict, which happens
when CloudConfig is created without reading defaults.

Change-Id: I8d035cfd1afc1cad01ceac7cd643568e94897e27

[{'created': '2017-12-08 21:07:23.000000000', 'message': "Pass through all_projects for get_server

This function currently does not allow getting of a server
from all projects, and it can be quite useful to do so (for
various admin/operator activities) so allow get_server to
pass through 'all_projects' to the internally called
'search_servers' (and default it to false to retain the old
behavior).

Change-Id: I7b7534a044cfa0ccbaa11a635edcca388db27f0f
"}]
commit_message:
Pass through all_projects for get_server

This function currently does not allow getting of a server
from all projects, and it can be quite useful to do so (for
various admin/operator activities) so allow get_server to
pass through 'all_projects' to the internally called
'search_servers' (and default it to false to retain the old
behavior).

Change-Id: I7b7534a044cfa0ccbaa11a635edcca388db27f0f

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I42b7dcd3e9e41688ac3bd8b9c9fb9b39f90c3e9a

commit_message:
Clarify SSH server requirements prior to tripleo-quickstart deployment

On servers with more restrictive SSH server configurations, it's
important to ensure that both the root and stack users have public
key access, and that the SSH server doesn't impose any unreasonable
timeouts on the client.

This documentation update suggests in advance what the operator can
do to ensure these conditions are met.

Change-Id: Ia0ebcf30b45ed85815c8331a6aa2d5e3995ce5b9

commit_message:
Support more hardware types and deprecate enabled_drivers

Ironic is going to deprecate classic drivers in Queens and remove them in Rocky.
This change enables hardware types ilo and idrac that correspond to alreadys
enabled classic drivers pxe_ilo and pxe_drac. It also adds support for others
common hardware types, but does not enable them by default.

The enabled_drivers option is deprecated.

This change mostly copies commit 58701fe014bf118ee0bbed5272c1a08e3f594ae0
from instack-undercloud, but adapts it for heat-driver undercloud.
Also adds staging-ovirt from review I3e5d0a72e2ba22537ce2c0eb30000c29f429dc3f

Change-Id: I3c20591a9900afb60aadcfa151b9ff29e7d3e16d

Attila and John are correct.. First off the change should be made to environment variables such that we can delineate between environments properly'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-12-08 13:48:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It would break the jobs we run not with zuulv3 aka rdocloud and reproducer jobs.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Looks correct to me as well, but let's wait for the gates from both systems."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

FYI.. test patch that should build a real change is here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526550/'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-08 15:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Gabriele brought up a good point on IRC: that previous directory was tripleo-root, where tripleo-ci is cloned. We probably need to change the TRIPLEO_ROOT variable in the CI repo instead of adjusting the cloning directory here to make things work correctly.'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2017-12-08 17:13:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Ok, summary of my findings. We are still using devstack to kick tripleo-ci and Tripleo-ci is still cloned by devstack using simple git commands, not zuul-cloner. devstack still uses /opt/stack/new as default location.
We removed all the other projects from the PROJECTS env var in the zuulv3 playbook run.yaml, so apparently all those repos are handled by zuul-cloner, which puts them in the new directory.
Other exceptions are tripleo-heat-templates and tripleo-images-elements, which may be both  cloned in /opt/stack/new by devstack and in the other dir by zuul-cloner.
As far as this patch anyway, I think it's safe to merge, after double checking we don't assume anywhere else the projets are still cloned in /opt/stack/new.
In a second moment, we can try to establish what's the best course of action to remove tripleo-ci from the PROJECTS hardcoded in devstack (we'll need to add it to the single PROJECTS in every other repo that uses tripleo-ci to be tested.
removing the dependency of devstack from tripleo is a task that can be ignored at the moment."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-08 17:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I see this was moved out to an environmental var for each of the test envs (yay). Also the depends-on patch has passed CI so approving to prevent any further spurious failures due to old code packaging. 

Note the fs35 failure was for cib issues not related to packaging.

I do think we need to rethink some of the assumptions being made around these types of locations as we move to cleaning up items to leverage zuulv3 more and devstack less.'}]

commit_message:
Add missing steps from tripleo-ci ovb playbook

We missed a couple of things that are in the tripleo-ci playbook,
namely undercloud-validate and overcloud-delete. These are both
added, but defaulted to off so as not to impact existing jobs which
use this playbook.

Change-Id: Ic2f1d2d50f8a5b0e19ca93e1b9631a94be91d3c5

subject: Use cachable facts to allow multiple runs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-05 15:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck this should not fail.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-12-06 17:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Question regarding caching, not a real -1'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

thanks Attila, reading through the other review and the mtg helped my understanding as well.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

More a question than a -1:
cachable is only set to true when a fact is *currently* used in another role. However, if a new role is added that requires a previously set fact, the user would have to go find that fact and set it cachable.

Is there any downside to making all set_fact steps cachable?'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> More a question than a -1:
 > cachable is only set to true when a fact is *currently* used in
 > another role. However, if a new role is added that requires a
 > previously set fact, the user would have to go find that fact and
 > set it cachable.
 > 
 > Is there any downside to making all set_fact steps cachable?

I prefer to not make "cacheable" necessary everywhere. It will be hard to keep it up, and it's not even important for most of the variables. In fact it's sort of a red flag when this is needed as the roles should be more or less self-contained.

As we're going to CI this method of run, it will be quite apparent if it is needed. And I guess we can say we will only support breaking points where we CI them.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2017-12-08 15:06:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'd accept that.
Although requiring cached facts for role like log collection/ job reproduction is legitimate.
The changes LGTM."}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-12-08 15:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

ya i agree that this really shows places where we do not have independent roles, so we dont want to use it everywhere.'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-08 16:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2017-12-08 17:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

* add "cachable: true" to set_fact calls when the fact would be used by

* consolidate the formatting of the set_fact calls, using the proper

Depends-On: I987d51cc252b7ebc3972d60497234fa676864882
Change-Id: I5dd3084ead618e357b1e7d841ea2ee794bd0569a
'}]
commit_message:
Use cachable facts to allow multiple runs

* add "cachable: true" to set_fact calls when the fact would be used by
  other roles in later runs; the other fact names were checked to make
  sure they are not referred to in other roles
* consolidate the formatting of the set_fact calls, using the proper
  yaml structure instead of `set_fact: foo=bar`

Depends-On: I987d51cc252b7ebc3972d60497234fa676864882
Change-Id: I5dd3084ead618e357b1e7d841ea2ee794bd0569a

commit_message:
Add configuration-parameter-list to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the configuration-parameter-list command.

The trove command configuration-parameter-list is now:
    openstack database configuration parameter list

Change-Id: I8e7ee36529b75b0962aeaf30a074b55b9e0cee12
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 20:08:58.000000000', 'message': "Add regression test for rebuild with new image doubling allocations

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on).

The problem is that change introduced a regression where the
FilterScheduler is going to think it's doing a resize to the same
host and double the allocations for the instance (and usage for the
compute node provider) in Placement, which is wrong since the
flavor is the same.

This adds a regression test to show the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): Due to cc833359870d3962326c35094adea2f525ec8141 not
being in Pike, we have to use the MediumFakeDriver until the bug
is fixed.

Change-Id: Ie0949b4e6101f0b29ec4542146d523a07a683991
Related-Bug: #1664931
(cherry picked from commit bfbdad9f7dadb7951bc3e3d75005a432b2e7ace6)
"}, {'created': '2017-11-28 01:52:56.000000000', 'message': "Add regression test for rebuild with new image doubling allocations

flavor is the same.

This adds a regression test to show the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): Due to cc833359870d3962326c35094adea2f525ec8141 not
being in Pike, we have to use the MediumFakeDriver until the bug
is fixed. Also, the ComputeManager._get_nodename method doesn't exist

commit_message:
Add regression test for rebuild with new image doubling allocations

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on).

The problem is that change introduced a regression where the
FilterScheduler is going to think it's doing a resize to the same
host and double the allocations for the instance (and usage for the
compute node provider) in Placement, which is wrong since the
flavor is the same.

This adds a regression test to show the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): Due to cc833359870d3962326c35094adea2f525ec8141 not
being in Pike, we have to use the MediumFakeDriver until the bug
is fixed. Also, the ComputeManager._get_nodename method doesn't exist
in Pike so we have to just get the hypervisor uuid from the os-hypervisors
API.

Change-Id: Ie0949b4e6101f0b29ec4542146d523a07a683991
Related-Bug: #1664931
(cherry picked from commit cacfd372acb4eb056c4391db3c988bfe91c957df)

commit_message:
Prevent image become active without disk and container formats

If you run image-import api on any image which is in uploading
state and does not have container-format and/or disk-format set
goes into active state. The reason is during import call status
is set to importing from uploading and while checking container
format and disk formats are specified only 'queued' status was
taken into consideration.

Added 'uploading' status where validation is done to check whether
disk format and container format is added to the image.

Change-Id: I2865d81a01e5ab5d113bd809c273a2876213e7d4
Closes-Bug: #1733816

commit_message:
remove tempest plugin install from convert image

We should install tempest plugins via the tempest role.
This is done at run time and is more transparent to the
user.

In this review we are also enabling tempest and
disabling ping test in order to test the consistency
in ci.centos.

Related-To: 1736252
Depends-On: I58a955943191045324956bd61da0652076984e8c
Change-Id: I04635ed37c4f40a7310d311539138ab0d64c0c97

commit_message:
Fix the expirer cron task to run correctly

We need to escape % for cron to run correctly. Without
this the cron task fails with syntax error.

Change-Id: I8eac2d978380ccc1c6998929c8aa6a440ed4bcce
(cherry picked from commit ad53878d79b240e0b12d3df4df222c3fa11a9e45)
(cherry picked from commit 08253231d7f5183fdb7c7ac2eb74f015c952f78e)

[{'created': '2017-12-07 22:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove RBD examples

RBD support was not part of BFV support, as booting using a
ceph block device was removed from the specification for BFV
as it is highly ramdisk dependent and support for booting from
such devices is unlikely to ever land in some of the available
ramdisk boot tools, muchless ironic or integrated tooling.

Change-Id: I9ddea3ae691240524aa6b946e1a513104a3f7113
'}]
commit_message:
Remove RBD examples

RBD support was not part of BFV support, as booting using a
ceph block device was removed from the specification for BFV
as it is highly ramdisk dependent and support for booting from
such devices is unlikely to ever land in some of the available
ramdisk boot tools, muchless ironic or integrated tooling.

Change-Id: I9ddea3ae691240524aa6b946e1a513104a3f7113

commit_message:
Added ability to generate kek for barbican simple crypto backend

The KEK is used in a fernet.Fernet encryptor so it needs to be a
32 byte base64 encoded string - just like the keystone Fernet
credentials.

Depends-On: I07e52897897f453382f74aa4fdaa98c37e6eca30
Change-Id: I192e9bc30d808d9d9b664f8d0d33966f98f5768b

commit_message:
stop linking to documentation from governance

All official projects can be listed in the data files used to generate
docs.openstack.org, so linking to their documentation from the
governance repo is redundant.

Change-Id: I12794bcb3a5c92ce01a545310df0e2954b9c98d5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 22:05:21.000000000', 'message': 'Grab package_ver from remote host

Ansible set_fact sets variables into the hostvars of the host they are
running on. We need to consume the remote hostvar for package_ver in the
context of localhost. So reach in to hostvars.

Set the host to ubuntu-xenial rather than all to be explicit.

Change-Id: I5a5c593cdf80d721a36187e1c552db21f4794b37
'}]
commit_message:
Grab package_ver from remote host

Ansible set_fact sets variables into the hostvars of the host they are
running on. We need to consume the remote hostvar for package_ver in the
context of localhost. So reach in to hostvars.

Set the host to ubuntu-xenial rather than all to be explicit.

Change-Id: I5a5c593cdf80d721a36187e1c552db21f4794b37

Document manual config-download

Add docs for manual execution of config-download.

Also fixes a few nits from the initial documentation.

This begins to document the playbooks that get generated. That will be
completed in further follow up patches.

messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-17 11:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-17 11:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Setting WF-1 to first check with tonyb, diablo_rojo and fungi that this matches their expectations.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-17 11:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from election-officials to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-11-27 13:12:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

(2 comments)

Makes sense, some nits which I'll post a follow up for."}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks fine to me. I added Emmet as a reviewer to see if he wants to be involved too having been an election official for the last two elections.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-28 08:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This should avoid some arguments that occured in the past.  The wording seems sensible to me.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 17:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-30 05:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Are there any other historically tc-related working groups that are not becoming SIGs that might fall under this too?'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Dean: Likely the VMT (while the rest of the Security Team transitions into a SIG). revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 11:14:00.000000000', 'message': 'Officialize election organization working group

Election officials never formally derived their authority from
governance documents, which created a bit of a loophole. It also
made election orgnization a bit ad-hoc at the last minute. In
Sydney our usual victims for the election official roles asked
for a more official definition of their role that would let them
do more long-term planning of election and tooling improvements.

This document proposes the creation of TC working groups (to match
the concept of UC working groups), and sets up the election officials
as one of those working groups.

Change-Id: I1e25a9324dafd23e08b388b966b48103537ac56e
'}]
commit_message:
Officialize election organization working group

Election officials never formally derived their authority from
governance documents, which created a bit of a loophole. It also
made election orgnization a bit ad-hoc at the last minute. In
Sydney our usual victims for the election official roles asked
for a more official definition of their role that would let them
do more long-term planning of election and tooling improvements.

This document proposes the creation of TC working groups (to match
the concept of UC working groups), and sets up the election officials
as one of those working groups.

Change-Id: I1e25a9324dafd23e08b388b966b48103537ac56e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 14:37:42.000000000', 'message': 'Tags are applied to deliverables, or teams

Clarify confusing language in tag descriptions around "projects".
Tags are either applied to project deliverables, or to the project
team.

Also move status:maintenance-mode to the "Team tags" section in
the index since that is how it is currently applied.

Change-Id: I0b63b3d65be64c572f2247dc9070245e78790db4
'}]
commit_message:
Tags are applied to deliverables, or teams

Clarify confusing language in tag descriptions around "projects".
Tags are either applied to project deliverables, or to the project
team.

Also move status:maintenance-mode to the "Team tags" section in
the index since that is how it is currently applied.

Change-Id: I0b63b3d65be64c572f2247dc9070245e78790db4

commit_message:
Fix issue with double mocking of utils.execute functions

An issue was discovered if we mock an already mock-ed function. This
was happening in our execute() detection code. Change it to not use a
mock and instead a function.

Add unit tests to show it works as intended.

Change-Id: Ia116b355e7adb3cbfb8ae34f4d59bf527f2889bb

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

I'd like to see an indication of how exactly you'll determine whether each type of object has changed, and what changes to e.g. the DB - if any - will be required to implement that.

I'm definitely not against adding this option to the existing APIs, but I'm not sold on the new APIs.

It'd be worth noting that we already support filtering in some cases, and syntactic sugar is fine but it'd be nice to implement it in the REST API code and have the RPC API stick with the more generic filtering."}, {'account_id': 20962, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Make the get_service_type() overrides tolernat of no defaults

The service type overrides in get_service_type() fail if the
API version keys are not present in the config dict, which happens
when CloudConfig is created without reading defaults.

Cherry-picked from I8d035cfd1afc1cad01ceac7cd643568e94897e27

Change-Id: I8d035cfd1afc1cad01ceac7cd643568e94897e27

commit_message:
Drop django_openstack_auth from Queens deliverables

In Queens dev cycle, django_openstack_auth code was merged into
the horizon repository and it no longer makes a separate release.
This commit drops django_openstack_auth from queens deliverables.

Part of blueprint merge-openstack-auth

Change-Id: Iebc1aefe552fb8b3710f3fc7ffcfa5ac945cde0b

commit_message:
Run upload-npm role on executor

The upload-npm role seems to expect to upload files from the
executor, so in the javascript post playbook we should tell it to
run on localhost rather than the job node.

Change-Id: Iee176655108362545029f87134e9f150e0e35c17

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 18:45:22.000000000', 'message': "Omit legacy npm job with nodejs4-publish-to-npm

When using the nodejs4-publish-to-npm project-template, its
release-openstack-javascript job is redundant with the
legacy-npm-upload job so remove the latter. Also in the case of
monasca-grafana-datasource there's no need for
publish-openstack-python-tarball since it doesn't work on that
project and was only added to satisfy (potentially invalid)
dependencies of the legacy-npm-upload job.

Change-Id: I7f1e98d0caee791271dcb08bbf4a76154fb065a3
"}]
commit_message:
Omit legacy npm job with nodejs4-publish-to-npm

When using the nodejs4-publish-to-npm project-template, its
release-openstack-javascript job is redundant with the
legacy-npm-upload job so remove the latter. Also in the case of
monasca-grafana-datasource there's no need for
publish-openstack-python-tarball since it doesn't work on that
project and was only added to satisfy (potentially invalid)
dependencies of the legacy-npm-upload job.

Change-Id: I7f1e98d0caee791271dcb08bbf4a76154fb065a3

commit_message:
Merge aodh tempest tests and configuration in ceilometer

* In order to achieve the tempest plugin split goal, we are merging
  the aodh tempest tests and config in to ceilometer, then we can move
  all the telemetry tests in a single repo.


Change-Id: I4e0952487d0fe73992e8fe9d6ddda3f98054ec60

commit_message:
Skip failures when collecting nic setups

The ethtool command can fail when run against some devices in some
configurations. This change simply makes the test collections pass
no matter the interface configuration.

Change-Id: I4475e4dfe13acb4c88444f1f7aa88272bf87f6ee
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Have doc8 ignore autodoc content

Sphinx autodoc is genereating titles that are too long do to the depth of
the module paths in octavia. This patch tells doc8 to ignore the auto
generated content.

commit_message:
Release python-cinderclient 3.3.0

This bumps python-cinderclient to 3.3.0 and with
the change come a number of features.  The following
microversions are merged:

- MV 3.45 -- Add support for with_count to list volume,
  backup and snapshot.
- MV 3.46 -- Support create bootable volume from nova
  0 size image.
- MV 3.47 -- Add create volume from backup support.
- MV 3.48 -- Adds support for shared_targets.

There are also bugfixes and requirements updates.

Change-Id: I1be2fb00f99970d77889b8333d50ca818f150a91

commit_message:
Remove LXC yum repo from containers

Ths LXC yum repository is being added to containers during the
cach prep step on CentOS. This causes delays/failures in the
containers and it's only needed on hosts.

Closes-Bug: 1737202
Change-Id: I3fdc313a43daae938357230cf99e2992ede11e01

commit_message:
Fix abnormal display with openstack database instance list

According bug description, openstack database instance list
abnormal display except first instance. The cause of the problem
is method set_attributes_for_print when return instances got a
wrong indentation. So just modify this. And modify tests to
validate it.

Change-Id: I6124706ba79ab13bbd769631f491e314784652c7
Closes-Bug: #1734228

commit_message:
Run tempest with its defaults

By default, tempest runs in parallel, with the amount of workers
depending on the CPU.

This adds an optional variable to define the concurrency or
serialization.

Change-Id: I7054cf78bbac9f84095d4b66d00f9d2cfea25ac5

commit_message:
Update the instructions and scripts needed for devstack

A few things have been updated in code but not in the READMEs
and scripting to allow a devstack deployment of Ceilosca
on top of a Ceilometer checkout.  This commit should fix that.

Most notable, the devstack/plugin.sh was modified to include
copying the ceilosca_mapping directory in to ceilometer.

Cherry pick bonus: limit keystonemiddleware < 4.19.0 to
avoid a memcache error that showed up in gates.

Change-Id: I269f5ec12c95c6ab2c0149ecc12811edbb60585e

commit_message:
Ensure networks are running before starting node

If you create an environment and want to start a node prior to running
the admin setup action, it will fail because the networks are not
currently started.  This change makes sure the networks are started
before starting the node via the node-start shell command.

Change-Id: I336ea88950e9239d02d3c72c49b3d17eb264e6c3

commit_message:
Add datastore-version-list to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the datastore-version-list command.

The trove command datastore-version-list is now:
    openstack datastore version list

Change-Id: I88dad48f857329d07e4d6662744420eeaae5c8a3
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Allow --meta on upload

Previously, the --meta option was only allowed on post or copy subcommands.

Change-Id: I87bf0338c34b5e89aa946505bee68dbeb37d784c
Closes-Bug: #1616238

commit_message:
bindep: Add dependencies for PDFs on Fedora

As described here:

  https://that.guru/blog/create-pdfs-for-openstack/

There's probably a bigger package that installs many of these, but this
is the bare minimum necessary to build it successfully on Fedora 27.

Change-Id: Ib802898203b8db59fc9d0b98811d5c84fb9a64f0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make ironic::drivers::ansible actually install required packages

It is assumed that ansible is installed, but realistically it does
not have to. This change install ansible and systemd-python (the latter
required for correct logging in the driver).

Change-Id: I50d15bdd210fa444a0354e3b38acf21ec9d0ac30

commit_message:
playbooks: bifrost-create-dib-image: Add required dib packages

mkfs.ext4 is used when building dib images so we need to make sure
it's installed on the host. This adds a new dib_host_required_packages
list to denote which packages are required on the host for the dib
process to work properly.

Change-Id: I7701e4525b6b6a4e01a324d724d139e9d7466d19

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 15:56:25.000000000', 'message': "Remove tripleo-ci patches from infra IRC channel

The tripleo-ci project reports patches to #openstack-infra, but it's not
actually an Infra project. Stop reporting patches. They are already
configured to report to tripleo.

Change-Id: I8dd98362a2bc279f5093ab7e112b8620e422dad1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove tripleo-ci patches from infra IRC channel

The tripleo-ci project reports patches to #openstack-infra, but it's not
actually an Infra project. Stop reporting patches. They are already
configured to report to tripleo.

Change-Id: I8dd98362a2bc279f5093ab7e112b8620e422dad1

This patch updates the keystone role to its latest available stable SHA's.

This update is done out of the release cycle to pull down stability
fixes within the roles. The change is required to ensure we're

Change-Id: I28bce6f62613651c2923785e61e4d1d8d3dc11de

commit_message:
Bump roles SHA

This patch updates the keystone role to its latest available stable SHA's.

This update is done out of the release cycle to pull down stability
fixes within the roles. The change is required to ensure we're
not being faced with pyldap breakage when building dependencies.

Change-Id: I28bce6f62613651c2923785e61e4d1d8d3dc11de

* It merges the intree freezer tempest plugin to a the newly
  seperated repo freezer-tempest-plugin

* Moves freezer/tests/integration/common.py to under freezer-tempest-plugin
  as it is consumed in tests/api/base.py .

* Excluding freezer/tests/freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_version.py

Change-Id: I6967f915758728827e8ddcd1a45a7023904b694e

commit_message:
Merge intree freezer tempest plugin

* It merges the intree freezer tempest plugin to a the newly
  seperated repo freezer-tempest-plugin

* Moves freezer/tests/integration/common.py to under freezer-tempest-plugin
  as it is consumed in tests/api/base.py .

* Excluding freezer/tests/freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_version.py
  as it is dependent on freezer project and it should be moved under
  integration tests.

Change-Id: I6967f915758728827e8ddcd1a45a7023904b694e

commit_message:
Expose swift_container and swift_endpoint_url in ironic::glance

Unfortunately, ironic cannot detect swift_endpoint_url from the service
catalog, so it has to be provided for 'ansible' and 'direct' deploy methods.

Change-Id: I9b19625ed7d86a7827e0c3ef16de1ef9b0976eb0
Related: blueprint ansible-deploy

commit_message:
Bump Max API version to 3.48

In order for Nova to be able to make use of the code
for shared_targets that has gone into Cinder we need to
bump to API Version to 3.48.

This bumps to 3.48 to match the latest add to the Cinder side:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524697/1

Change-Id: Icaa17654bd2810098d02f8074fedb35c5221cd55

commit_message:
Remove deprecated oslo_messaging.get_transport

DeprecationWarning:
Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport.
Replace get_transport with get_rpc_transport.

Change-Id: Iea7ed92aa481b5d1c016693a12b623887c4e86bb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 16:05:32.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal NIC list should return a list

Since the list_nics* methods were changed to use raw HTTP client rather
than the ironic client, they return a dict rather than a list. Instead
of getting this:

[{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]

We get this:

{'ports': [{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]}

This change removes this outer dict and returns to the old behaviour of
returning a list. This affects list_nics and list_nics_for_machine.

Change-Id: I3cb9ef5d97cf911cb4897b00ab4cef77b76efaa4
"}, {'created': '2017-12-06 20:59:28.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal NIC list should return a list

Since the list_nics* methods were changed to use raw HTTP client rather
than the ironic client, they return a dict rather than a list. Instead
of getting this:

[{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]

We get this:

{'ports': [{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]}

This change removes this outer dict and returns to the old behaviour of
returning a list. This affects list_nics and list_nics_for_machine.

Change-Id: I3cb9ef5d97cf911cb4897b00ab4cef77b76efaa4
"}]
commit_message:
Baremetal NIC list should return a list

Since the list_nics* methods were changed to use raw HTTP client rather
than the ironic client, they return a dict rather than a list. Instead
of getting this:

[{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]

We get this:

{'ports': [{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]}

This change removes this outer dict and returns to the old behaviour of
returning a list. This affects list_nics and list_nics_for_machine.

Change-Id: I3cb9ef5d97cf911cb4897b00ab4cef77b76efaa4

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Id0c51375402e9ee1255d25c685821bace9b6084a
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Id0c51375402e9ee1255d25c685821bace9b6084a

It's often expected that OpenStack-Ansible wire things up.
While we decide if we need to wire Magnum up in group vars to
a variable that's not defined on all the deployments [1], we
should at least document how to configure os_magnum.

[1]: We could reuse the cinder_default_volume_type, but this
variable is not set in all the environments, or set only to
the cinder nodes. It would risk being wrongly wired, and not

commit_message:
Clarify cinder integration documentation

It's often expected that OpenStack-Ansible wire things up.
While we decide if we need to wire Magnum up in group vars to
a variable that's not defined on all the deployments [1], we
should at least document how to configure os_magnum.

[1]: We could reuse the cinder_default_volume_type, but this
variable is not set in all the environments, or set only to
the cinder nodes. It would risk being wrongly wired, and not
work. This could lead to issues in the expectations.

Closes-Bug: 1721878
Change-Id: I2eca155484e8d4440ec2ece91a7c4e3e3b610950

commit_message:
Avoid stashed connector lookup for new style detach

We can avoid all of the stashed connector hulabaloo
when detaching a volume if we're using a new style
attachment, because we don't need a host connector
in that case, stashed or not, we just delete the
attachment and we're done. This also helps to avoid
some confusion about whether or not we need to stash
a connector in the connection_info for the new style
attachment flow (we don't).

Part of blueprint cinder-new-attach-apis

Change-Id: I1404842f91279dd40ec9e03ccbbfe11cfc48520c

dependency was not working in the gate, so switch to this way
instead.

commit_message:
Use the same hash and created_at value in shard db

When moving to sharding state, match the current hash and created_at of
the old locked db.

This patch also cleans up a few todos in the area, including placing
the tmp db in the tmp folder so cleanup is taken care of if something
dies leaving tmp dbs lying around.

Change-Id: I5196ecbd1a18472129fcc801f17eba8e8c5bc342

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I1e72cf7084ed0b6fcd3c5df1f31b3fa6c7734d31

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 15:32:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix crontab errors on CentOS/SUSE

CentOS comes with a default empty crontab file that is fine for
most deployers. It also lacks the `--report` option for `run-parts`
that Ubuntu has.

SUSE doesn't have run-parts at all.

This causes the server administrator to receive emails with errors
from cron on a regular basis. This patch limits the crontab
deployment to Ubuntu only and skips CentOS/SUSE hosts.

Closes-Bug: 1732762
Change-Id: Iba714e1e20e1a27b1a5bb58a714dee3916faba8f
(cherry picked from commit c4d12eba1b5b6c27b318b84a58a442ee80aa9db0)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix crontab errors on CentOS/SUSE

CentOS comes with a default empty crontab file that is fine for
most deployers. It also lacks the `--report` option for `run-parts`
that Ubuntu has.

SUSE doesn't have run-parts at all.

This causes the server administrator to receive emails with errors
from cron on a regular basis. This patch limits the crontab
deployment to Ubuntu only and skips CentOS/SUSE hosts.

Closes-Bug: 1732762
Change-Id: Iba714e1e20e1a27b1a5bb58a714dee3916faba8f
(cherry picked from commit c4d12eba1b5b6c27b318b84a58a442ee80aa9db0)

commit_message:
Do not access dbapi attributes on dbsync import

This may cause troubles as some config options may not be
registered yet on the import of dbsync module. Accessing
dbapi attributes, which is lazy-loaded, will force the
object to initialize, and it may fail at such an early
stage.

Change-Id: I3b37498325a191f7c42b3b856b1b2cf326d57492

commit_message:
Add swift_store_large_object_chunk_size parameter

Add a new parameter to swift backend to let user set the chunk size when
glance will start chunking the images before uploading.

Change-Id: I9984bdb416ec9d874345b410557ef42c360232fb
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

Check the timestamp of the most recently completed child and

Closes-Bug: 1736987
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition between task completion and child task processing

Check the timestamp of the most recently completed child and
proceed with the integrity restoration only if this happened
later than the check delay.

Change-Id: Icff2be3e1fbd6db78d371183521d7fbda8d3d72c
Closes-Bug: 1736987

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 06:36:27.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is
entirely due to the current convention of pulling in the version
information. Release notes should not need installation in order
to build, so this unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.
This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html .

Change-Id: I32dd5453b4d05e46cfd1cddfc5d2f885ce53da83
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is
entirely due to the current convention of pulling in the version
information. Release notes should not need installation in order
to build, so this unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.
This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html .

Change-Id: I32dd5453b4d05e46cfd1cddfc5d2f885ce53da83

subject: Use cachable facts to allow multiple runs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27253, 'name': 'Sam Doran', 'email': 'sdoran@redhat.com', 'username': 'sdoran'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-12-04 19:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wonder if there is some way to globally change the default from cacheable:false to cacheable:true. That would be much more future proof if so.'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I wonder if there is some way to globally change the default from
 > cacheable:false to cacheable:true. That would be much more future
 > proof if so.

I agree, I was looking into it but didn't find any way to do it. Only found signs that others were trying to do the same and there's no way for it, for example: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29140556/overriding-ansible-module-options-defaults"}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-05 17:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-05 17:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

full-ci-check'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:59:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So I think if a fact was set and it is cached, it wins over role default for future collisions. We should keep this in mind then using a shotgun :)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Another corner case I can foresee is a code that sets a fact is it was undefined. We should examine quickstart and extras for those as well.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

if it was undefined*'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:09:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> So I think if a fact was set and it is cached, it wins over role
 > default for future collisions. We should keep this in mind then
 > using a shotgun :)

This is what I was expecting too. Not much changes. What we should keep in mind is to warn people to not reuse virtenvs or delete the fact cache when starting from scratch.

 > Another corner case I can foresee is a code that sets a fact if it was undefined. We should examine quickstart and extras for those as well.

This new method doesn't make any difference in case we run the whole playbook in one go as before."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

ok, thanks for answering. I added Sam Doran in the review, just in case we missed something.'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

When you use set_fact, that sets a host_var, which overrides role defaults but not vars within a role. host_vars are about in the middle of the var precedence stack.

There is no global default to enable caching all facts set via set_fact.

A better approach than caching all the set facts would be to use a custom facts module or modules. The output from the custom facts module would be cached.'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Use custom facts modules rather than set_fact with cacheable: true'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:54:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Sam's comment is really valid, we should probably do that way. Any thoughts Attila?"}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:59:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd be happy to help with custom facts modules."}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Use custom facts modules rather than set_fact with cacheable: true

Hi Sam, thanks for the review. I might not know how you imaging writing a custom fact module for this, but I don't see it as an improvement over this.

One option I evaluated and dismissed is using local facts (dump them at the end of some parts of the playbook, and read them back with the setup module). The problem with that is

1) it won't repopulate the facts at the same namespace as before (it will be ansible_local.* instead of just root level facts on the host)
2) dumping and reloading them will be a lot more hassle than just rely on caching, you actually need to dump the json file on the slave and make sure setup gets called after the user starts another playbook

Also it wouldn't be nice to try to recalculate all the facts (as custom facts modules do, we need them as they were original) and it's nice that we don't have to set them all cacheable (I was a lot more selective in the quickstart extras change about setting them only where needed).

I don't see how things can be more clear than designating some facts as "persistent between runs" which we do with cache timeout disabled and setting them cacheable where needed.

Please let me know what I missed, there might be some ansible magic that I totally missed.'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think this actually solves the use case we need it for. We only need the set_facts from one playbook run to persist at the same precedence in another playbook run. This change accomplishes that.

We are currently working on a sprint to allow running individual playbooks from the CI code so as to use it to setup development environments. If we overcomplicate this by creating custom facts modules that will almost certainly mean we do not accomplish that goal this sprint.

If there is some serious downside to what we are doing, obviously that is worth delaying for. However, I am not seeing that.'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:17:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sam Doran wrote:

> A better approach than caching all the set facts would be to use a
> custom facts module or modules. The output from the custom facts
> module would be cached.

That could be ideal if we want to force all the custom fact to be cacheable.
I don't think we need this measure. Cacheable is all we need at this point."}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the cleanup too. witing for the final decisions on custom module before merging'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing this with the reproducer script now'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2017-12-07 17:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

worked for the reproducer script: https://logs.rdoproject.org/43/525743/12/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode-upgrades-master/Zd57cb5f6c35441948adac0485ab12b43/reproducer-quickstart.sh ... see dlrn_hash'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2017-12-07 17:52:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> That could be ideal if we want to force all the custom fact to be cacheable. I don't think we need this measure. Cacheable is all we need at this point.

It looked like you were changing all the `set_fact` tasks to cacheable, which would be easier to do with a single custom facts module. If you want selective control of which facts are cached and which aren't, then you have to stick with your current approach. Or you could write a custom facts module to cover the things you do wanted cached, and use set_fact for those things you don't want cached.

Local facts wouldn't be the way to solve this. Local facts are meant to be a mechanism for other things to signal Ansible, not a way for Ansible to leave notes to itself."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-07 17:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-12-08 10:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2017-12-04 15:36:42.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: use cachable facts to allow multiple runs

This only changes the place of the fact cache so far and one file to

Change-Id: I987d51cc252b7ebc3972d60497234fa676864882
'}, {'created': '2017-12-05 14:29:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use cachable facts to allow multiple runs

* add "cachable: true" to every set_fact invocation to include them in
  the cached facts; most of these are not necessary as they are not used
  outside the roles, but it would be difficult to guess which ones are
  really necessary, so using the shotgun approach to avoid days or weeks
  of debugging
* disable the expiration of facts so that we can rely on them being
  there even if days pass between the reruns
* move the fact cache into the virtual environment directory (this is
  usually the local_working_dir if quickstart.sh is used to set things
  up); there can be some issues when no clean virtenv is created for new
  deployments and resulting in using stale facts

Change-Id: I987d51cc252b7ebc3972d60497234fa676864882
'}]
commit_message:
Use cachable facts to allow multiple runs

* add "cachable: true" to every set_fact invocation to include them in
  the cached facts; most of these are not necessary as they are not used
  outside the roles, but it would be difficult to guess which ones are
  really necessary, so using the shotgun approach to avoid days or weeks
  of debugging
* disable the expiration of facts so that we can rely on them being
  there even if days pass between the reruns
* move the fact cache into the virtual environment directory (this is
  usually the local_working_dir if quickstart.sh is used to set things
  up); there can be some issues when no clean virtenv is created for new
  deployments and resulting in using stale facts

Change-Id: I987d51cc252b7ebc3972d60497234fa676864882

commit_message:
Correct a task name in create_swift_rings_backup_container_plan

When the `create_container` task fails it calls
`set_create_container_failed` to handle the error. However, the YAQL
expression in that task refers to `set_create_container`, it should be
looking for the result of the failing action `create_container`.

Closes-Bug: 1736993
Change-Id: I7a47e295d13ed1a8a82c9270c0ccbc29f82a3743

commit_message:
Use constants from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains a number of the plugin related constants from
neutron.plugins.common.constants. This patch consumes those constants
from neutron-lib.

NOTE:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522817/1 is squashed into this change.

Change-Id: Id05ceb57a424f3a416a5b5b387bb401b2beb5e2a

commit_message:
Use the docker profile to set INSECURE_REGISTRY

This patch updates our instack-undercloud configuration so that
we leverage the tripleo::profile::base::docker manifest's
insecure_registry parameter to manage INSECURE_REGISTRY.
This makes sense since that setting is directly related to
the docker service itself and not the docker registry.

This can prevent these two manifests from clobbering each others
settings if they are both used alongside of each other.

Change-Id: I9e9c495b9095590dcee14e0705728c68c058d2b5
Related-bug: #1736587

commit_message:
Add parameters for container creation

This patch adds 'auto_remove', 'hostname' and 'runtime' parameters
for container creation. Also, adds these parameters into details
view. These parameters are not for update, so these are readonly
in update dialog.

Change-Id: I011008023158dabf6f69b3b1695d6ed3eaed849d
Implements: blueprint add-create-options-for-queens

commit_message:
Add DockerRegistryMirror parameter

We want to use this for the containerized undercloud to
be able to consume an in-rack registry mirror for
our CI jobs.

Change-Id: Ia0a2b4a2ddd99c9ee9b71875b144824aa7543da1

commit_message:
Adds UpgradeInitScript for any upgrade init bash

The UpgradeInitScript is a path to a bash script that can be
passed into the first step of the upgrade
(major-upgrade-composable-steps-docker) to perform any upgrade
tasks such as repo switch. Initially this will be used by CI
using the upgrade role.

Change-Id: I15d9d3adc468c07c724cb1d242064522c4132d9d

'}, {'created': '2017-07-14 07:22:09.000000000', 'message': 'Implement Upgrade workflow via the tripleo cli

This patch implement the workflow by using the cli and
the mistral workflow implemented in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463765/

It give to the user the opportunity to upgrade their
Overcloud with a such command:
openstack overcloud upgrade --steps ctlplane

The workflow will use the default tht dir is none
has been provided, update only the new templates
and those who has been updated and will keep all
the user parameters.

3 steps is implemetend:
ctlplane steps
nodes steps
and converge steps

Depends-On: I70193dccd6e70f53a2d09d6de5f66a5b8a40f144
Change-Id: Ic13b9c17b7b52acf086e7bf9159559b10fa44271

'}, {'created': '2017-11-15 07:52:04.000000000', 'message': 'Implement Upgrade workflow via the tripleo cli

This review implement the workflow for the major
upgrade for Queens.
Its create a new entry point for the major upgrade
with a command such as:
openstack overcloud upgrade ...
Its stick to the minor update workflow and use
a big part of it:
* package_update workbook to get the heat-setup-output
  download the role_data configuration and upload it
  to swift.
* kick the mistral ansible update/upgrade with the
  package_update workbook

This implementation is maor upgrade specific because
it needs to have the converge step as a third step
and also give a way to add extra-env files in case
of operator specific or in the case of the fast forward
upgrade (FFU), which needs to run the major upgrade
from a Queens undercloud on a Newton overcloud

Depends-On: I70193dccd6e70f53a2d09d6de5f66a5b8a40f144
Change-Id: Ic13b9c17b7b52acf086e7bf9159559b10fa44271

a big part of it:
* package_update workbook to get the heat-setup-output
  download the role_data configuration and upload it
  to swift.
* kick the mistral ansible update/upgrade with the
  package_update workbook

This implementation is maor upgrade specific because
it needs to have the converge step as a third step
and also give a way to add extra-env files in case
of operator specific or in the case of the fast forward
upgrade (FFU), which needs to run the major upgrade
from a Queens undercloud on a Newton overcloud

Depends-On: I70193dccd6e70f53a2d09d6de5f66a5b8a40f144
Change-Id: Ic13b9c17b7b52acf086e7bf9159559b10fa44271
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Upgrade workflow via the tripleo cli

This review implement the workflow for the major
upgrade for Queens.
Its create a new entry point for the major upgrade
with a command such as:
openstack overcloud upgrade ...
Its stick to the minor update workflow and use
a big part of it:
* package_update workbook to get the heat-setup-output
  download the role_data configuration and upload it
  to swift.
* kick the mistral ansible update/upgrade with the
  package_update workbook

This implementation is maor upgrade specific because
it needs to have the converge step as a third step
and also give a way to add extra-env files in case
of operator specific or in the case of the fast forward
upgrade (FFU), which needs to run the major upgrade
from a Queens undercloud on a Newton overcloud

Depends-On: I70193dccd6e70f53a2d09d6de5f66a5b8a40f144
Change-Id: Ic13b9c17b7b52acf086e7bf9159559b10fa44271

commit_message:
Add n-g-s gerritbot to ironic IRC channel

as openstack/networking-generic-switch was officially included
into OpenStack Baremetal program
(see change Ie08c9ef029e29845c766d9c10329817124954e16),
add gerritbot notifications for it to the #openstack-ironic IRC channel.

Change-Id: I25d42fa6c3b2b5faa143e4b42c5695ec6cc445e6

commit_message:
DNM: ffu: Remove yum update from upgrade_tasks

I'm attempting to verify if this is still required or if we can replace
it with more targetted yum update calls for packages on the host.

This reverts commit 9d8e2836fe7fca186e0380d8a532540ff5cc5215.

commit_message:
Revert "Use oslo_cache in auth_token middleware"

This reverts commit 9d8e2836fe7fca186e0380d8a532540ff5cc5215.

This implementation of oslo.cache use the global cfg.CONF directly.

But now many projects does not use this global and creates a
cfg.ConfigOpts() that's passed around everywhere.

Change-Id: I80f233ab58caddd381cd3f44091e0e0fa21d3e0e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 03:29:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add newline to zanata source-repository file

Without the newline this falls into the old bash "read" gotcha trick
where the last line will be skipped silently.  This means the client
isn't actualy downloaded.

dib-lint added a check in I23e293b957cd4f008611656cf9166391b1b537a2
and I tested it would have caught this.

Change-Id: Idbae2037f275fad91b87e1cf5ee80663c1f05ddc
'}]
commit_message:
Add newline to zanata source-repository file

Without the newline this falls into the old bash "read" gotcha trick
where the last line will be skipped silently.  This means the client
isn't actualy downloaded.

dib-lint added a check in I23e293b957cd4f008611656cf9166391b1b537a2
and I tested it would have caught this.

Change-Id: Idbae2037f275fad91b87e1cf5ee80663c1f05ddc

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

Change-Id: I0dee88e5e7bc8a07870f2df1c612dbf89e197bf8

commit_message:
Temporarily disable check-reqs for designate

In [1] the requirements-check was extended to cover the file
"doc/requirements.txt", which has been present in designate unchanged
since 2014. Since the check is trying to not only verify the proposed
change, but also current status, we currently cannot merge the fix for
this issue [2][3].

So temporarily disable this check for designate, allowing [2] to merge,
after that the current patch will be reverted.

python-designateclient has the same issue.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/522640
[2] https://review.openstack.org/526097
[3]
http://logs.openstack.org/97/526097/1/check/requirements-check/1f04269/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-06_15_32_05_884483

Change-Id: Idd4233cd393848ec1456bd8fbbed7529c3610643
Needed-By: Ibc77ea864503e63f73be0f1c41e07bfe8ea3dcae
